Reviews.Title: “There for business; yet, what pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: ACJ611
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Rosewood Hotel Georgia was a phenomenal experience. The hotel is upscale and modern, yet, understated in a traditional sense. The staff is attentive and pleasant but, not obtrusive. The room was incredibly comfortable and housekeeping came twice per day. I had an amazing 80 minute hot stone massage at the spa. Sherri was very experienced and customized the massage to accommodate my requests. Another great feature was the salt water lap pool which was extremely relaxing. I am not a swimmer; yet, for some reason I was compelled to swim laps at Hotel Georgia. The therapeutic lights in the pool was a new experience for me and something I really enjoyed. I think light therapy really works! Another memorable moment was when I arrived one evening with a bottle of wine, cheese and a loaf of French bread to take up to my room. The concierge assessed my fare and kindly asked if I would like a plate and knife to enjoy my "dinner". Room service arrived less that 3 minutes later at my door with a sharp knife, plate and napkin. The service at the hotel was exceptional and it was an experience I will always remember.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel. Great location”
Reviews.Author: tdLeeds
Reviews.Content: I arrived 24 hours later than planned (thanks BA) and expected the normal kind of hotel welcome experience.....but wow....completely different experience. Was treated like royalty!! The room was superb. As there on business, didn't get to experience the spa or the pool, but the room and bathroom were so comfortable and clean. Ok, so the room wasnt massive, but it was more than big enough for a business traveller. The hotel lobby bar did nice food, well presented, quickly delivered by friendly staff and was a decent price. The one time I did make breakfast I found it a little expensive. I suppose I'm more used to the buffet style. Maybe next time I'll avoid the fresh OJ. Room rate was sort of as expected for a city centre hotel, but could easily have been much,much more. Very friendly staff. I'd definitely use this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal service, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: emilyCO
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel--from the time I made my reservation to when I checked out, the service was exceptional. I was heading to a conference in Vancouver and Diane in reservations worked with me to ensure we were able to stay in the hotel even though the conference organizers could not get us a room. Thank you, Diane! The hotel property was amazing but it was the service and attention to detail that blew me away. From the turn down service that came with a bottle of water and shortbread cookie, to the Nespresso machine in the room, to the beautiful gym-- it was all wonderful. The bathroom is incredible as well. Beautiful accents made me feel as if I was in a spa bathroom. When we asked for a sushi reservation that was close to the hotel, the concierge recommended a delicious and very reasonably priced place. The concierge made a reservation for us and then followed up to make sure it was up to our expectations. On our last day, we checked out and were heading straight to the airport. The concierge on duty recommended that we take the sky train to save a bunch of money and time. He even walked us part way over to the station. Overall, I am extremely pleased with this hotel. Service is exceptional. I will now go out of my way to see if there is a Rosewood hotel in any city that I am visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mcdessureault
Reviews.Content: Simply amazing service... Attention to the littlest detail, amazing room, the most comfortable bed ever!! From check-in to check-out, everyone is extremely professional, helpful and genuine. Handwritten personalized welcome note, turndown service, everything was perfect. They even sent me a custom declaration form to the room so that I could have an extra 2 minutes sleep for a very early flightbthe next morning! And the hotel is simply beautiful!! Best hotel stay ever!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Caymanss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Georgia over the Easter holiday weekend. The location was excellent. It was easy walking distance to the Pacific Centre, Robson Street, and Gastown. The room was a nice size and bathroom was well laid out with heated floors. Many thanks to the concierge team as they were the most helpful we have ever encountered. We ate at the Hawksworth Restaurant and at Reflections and all meals were exceptional. Looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool but incredibly tiny room and arrogance”
Reviews.Author: dan r
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night at the Rosewood. It was supposed to be five nights as I was at a conference. We were really looking forward to it. The pool was wonderful on the first day. However, the room was very well appointed but very small for two people. We put up with it for the first night. It was a funny shaped room - very long and narrow. My wife kept saying that we wouldn't be spending any time in the room anyways..... The room overlooked the interior courtyard and on the second night a band was playing in the court yard. I phoned and complained about the noise and was told that the band would only be playing to 11:00 pm or so. . I said that my expectation was that when I rented a room, I expected it to be quiet. Further more that they knew that I was staying for five nights and that if they had a band going for a event, they should not have booked the rooms overlooking the court yard. There was no apology. Simply a reiteration that the band would shut down around 11:00 pm. I insisted on another room demanded to speak to the night manager. Got a phone call back about 15 minute later (9:30 pm or so) and more talk about the band shutting down. I got pretty angry and hung the phone. Phoned the Sutton Place (2 blocks away) and they had a room. Then I got another phone from the front desk of the Rosewood saying they would be giving me a 'complimentary upgrade'. Talk about arrogance! They were the ones that booked me into a room that they should never had let given that they had a band going. Said thanks but no thanks and that I would be downstair in five minutes to pay my bill. Which I did. My wife and I then caught cab over to the Sutton Place. Sutton Place was great. The rooms are good sized and it was really nice and quiet. Gym was okay.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel gem”
Reviews.Author: Idmd
Reviews.Content: A great location, with easy walking distance to the downtown sights. But even better than that: the wonderful rooms, with the comforts one would want; and the terrific service, with the staff that were friendly and extraordinarily helpful. Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: mdadPA
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great hotel. I will stay again in Rosewood hotel for my next trip to Vancouver. I stayed three nights there and had a great experience. Every staff I met was very kind and helpful. The room was very clean, luxurious, and modern, not to mention the signature bathroom. In addition, indoor swimming pool was also very nice and convenient to use especially when you have a small child. There might be a better hotel, but this was the best hotel I have ever stayed so far, considering all the factors - staff, room, location, facilities, price, etc. My wife and daughter also liked the hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “Better than my High Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Tardawg
Reviews.Content: On my recent trip to Vancouver British Columbia with my son to visit University of British Columbia we stayed at the Rosewood Hotel Georgia based on the reviews posted on Trip Advisor. The reviews ranked it as one of the top hotels in downtown Vancouver so I was expecting a superior experience. The hotel and particularly the staff far exceeded my expectations. First the location: Rode Sky-train from airport to City center station-30 minutes. Rosewood is 1 block from the station. Vancouver Art Gallery across the street,Waterfront a few blocks down the hill. A few blocks more Gas town's great restaurants. Speaking of restaurants the hotel restaurant "Hawksworth" is fantastic. We had breakfast & light dinner, both wonderful. Great wine list. Additionally "Reflections Lounge" an open air area is a great spot to sip a glass of wine outside by the fire in the crisp Vancouver evening. The pool, exercise and spa areas are also exceptional. Lovely facilities and super staff. Speaking of staff be sure to meet Jim. He drove us (in his Bentley) to catch the sunset at English Bay(recommended by the concierge (i am sorry I forgot your name). Later in the weekend he joined us @ Reflections. What a wonderful gentleman. The Rosewood group has created a fantastic oasis in downtown Vancouver not to be missed for a special visit to a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “A 21st centrury oasis of grace and ellegance in the downtown core”
Reviews.Author: GourmetTravel888
Reviews.Content: Absolutely splendid. Old world charm. Totally updated. Very tastefully decorated. The rooms are spacious, richly appointed, with loads of smart and beautiful fine details. Very relaxing ambiance. Large bathrooms with an amazing soaker tub, separate rain shower stall, and wonderfully heated tiled floors. The staff is so welcoming, efficient, and engaging. Great pool and spa. Terrific cocktails at the bar, great food at Hawksworth. Definitely, worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Anniversary Special”
Reviews.Author: B K
Reviews.Content: We saw on our local television station the re-opening of the Rosewood Hotel (2011) after it had undergone a 3 year renovation. My wife and I celebrated our anniversary there as it is just an amazed Hotel that is personable but professionally run. They are extremely fussing about quality and pay attention to the smallest detail. The hotel is the same vintage as the Millineum Biltmore in Los Angels and has a similar history with movie stars and famous people from around the world but it is far above the Biltmore's tired interior. The fitness facilities and dinning have been awarded one of the best in Canada. What makes the location special is that it is directly across from the Art Gallery and only minutes away from the famous Robson Street and Harbour Convention Centre. This is truly a winner and you will not go broke when it come to paying your bill when you depart.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vicki3
Reviews.Content: Lovely boutique hotel with nice rooms, but not my favourite Vancouver hotel. We stayed with our daughter, and I didn't find them very accomodating upon check in...charged us $30 extra when I asked for room with 2 beds, when it was the same room category and hotel wasn't busy, and we were first time guests, and asked for a children's robe and never did receive one (which is nice to have when going to the pool) I loved the pool but wish there would have been a hot tub or steam room...and there was no little extra treat like cookies or chocolates in room as complimentary welcome treat like many hotels do....again...very lovely hotel, liked the room, but in my opinion not deserving of the number spot on tripadvisor..we will go back to our favourite hotel with 5 star service next time....

Reviews.Title: “The Rosewood Hotel Georgia is One Class Act!”
Reviews.Author: ladydocBC
Reviews.Content: Having been to some of the best hotels in Europe, Great Britain, and recently, Maui, I'm excited to report that one of the finest establishments I've ever stayed at is right here in my home province of British Columbia! The Rosewood Hotel exudes class and style everywhere - from the well-appointed, modern rooms to the dapper bellboys and the conceirge service. We enjoyed our stay on the 10th floor in a "Junior Suite". The ensuite was magnificent - loved the heated floors, huge, thirsty bath towels and robes and the soft, modern lighting that was controlled from multiple locations in the room. This was basically an appartment without the the kitchen. The bar is stocked with all your favorite items. It was my birthday and we arrived to a small chocolate mousse cake decorated in edible gold foil as a welcome. How thoughtful. Although we didn't get to try out the spa or the pool, we did have a glorious meal at Hawksworth Restaurant (which I will review separately.) I will be staying here whenever I'm in Vancouver for the weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, best service, tiny closets”
Reviews.Author: ms_momma_08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Rosewood Hotel Georgia while in town for a conference (USCAP). We have stayed at Rosewood resorts before and always had an amazing experience. This was no different. The room was amazing, with modern amenities including a nespresso machine (my husband loved this and used it every day) and convenient buttons on the wall to control lighting, including one right next to the bed to turn on the "privacy" sign, which was extremely convenient! I hate it when I get in bed then realize I forgot to put the privacy sign out on the door... The best part of the room is the bathroom. The floors are heated, the whole bathroom is covered with beautiful dark brown marble and the shower is amazing. It's huge and has 4 rain shower heads. The bathroom itself is also quite large and takes up about 1/3rd of the room or more. The only complaint I have about the room is that the closet is teeny and there's no way to stow your suitcases or unpack all of your clothes. I don't think this would be as big of a deal in the summer but when we went it was really cold so we had a lot of bulky clothes. Also there was some street noise that made it a little difficult to sleep some nights. We could have used a sound machine but it didn't bother us so much that we went out of our way to find some way to block the noise. The hotel is conveniently located and was an easy downhill 10 minute walk to the convention center every morning. It is also in easy walking distance of many great restaurants. As far as the hotel staff, they could not have been more friendly or helpful. Every concierge we talked to there gave us the best recommendations and was extremely helpful. Same for the front desk and staff at the hotel restaurant, which we went to for drinks and dessert. Drinks were good, dessert was OK. But like I said, best service ever. I couldn't have asked for anything more. We also sampled the spa. I got a relaxation massage and the cocoon treatment, both of which were heavenly. I also got a manicure and pedicure. My husband got a deep tissue massage that he wasn't too impressed with. He also got the shower tapas as well as the scalp tapas, both of which he really enjoyed. Again the staff was very professional, did a great job and really went the extra mile to make you feel relaxed. The spa itself was absolutely beautiful, with a great cozy relaxation room and really beautiful facilities. We didn't bring our swimsuits but wish we had after we saw the pool. It, too, was really beautiful with large dark brown marble pillars and a beautiful tile deck. The bottom of the pool has large panels of lights that slowly change colors. We did go to the gym, which has all state of the art equipment and a small room for doing non-machine related exercises, as well as a set of free weights. The gym is also really aesthetically pleasing and is surrounded by large floor to ceiling windows so you can watch the city below. The staff keeps the gym sparkly clean, coming in every 20 minutes or so to tidy up. They keep cool water and cool towels readily available. Some of the cardio machines even have games on them that you can play while you work out, which I thought was a pretty neat feature. I really enjoyed working out in it and wish I had been able to use it more. Overall a great experience. I would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “A truly amazing dining experience!”
Reviews.Author: Susan L
Reviews.Content: Last night we had the priviledge of dining at Hawksworth Restaurant, located in the Rosewood Hotel Georgia in Vancouver. From the moment of arrival through to the end of our dining experience the service was flawless, white glove service without the white gloves. The menu selection was exquisite and after some time we narrowed down our choices. I can honestly say that our dinner at Hawksworth Restaurant took dining to another level. Hats off to the chef who deserves an award for incredible creativity and taste. Hawksworth is at the top of my list of leading restaurants in Vancouver. A memorable evening and Hawksworth will be recommended by us over and over again. Susan Lerch Vancouver, B.C.

Reviews.Title: “Service, style, and location are unbelievable!”
Reviews.Author: Foodsnob1973
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the 3rd weekend in March and was blown away. We always stay at 5 star hotels, but this one was special. From the second I arrived I felt like royalty as the lovely doorman from New Brunswick helped me from the taxi. This hotel is gorgeous, mixing sophisticated contemporary with traditional dark formality if that makes sense? The location is perfect; easy walk to Yaletown, Gastown, Chinatown, etc. Mathew and Connie, two of the concierges were sincerely sweet, eager, and helpful-they really made the trip. The beds were incredible, rooms were pleasing and comfortable, and the bathrooms with their heated floors, double sinks, enormous rain shower, and cool oval soaking tub was a real treat. You cannot go wrong staying here!

Reviews.Title: “An attention to detail experience!”
Reviews.Author: Gaylehr
Reviews.Content: This recently reborn classic Vancouver hotel has an exquisite attention to detail and a focus on what matters to the traveler, either business, tourist or romantic getaway. The rooms are like little jewel boxes, very luxurious, but it's the bathroom that is spectacular. No bumping into one and other, heated marble floors, huge freestanding bath, large luxe shower. Service is charming, best looking staff I've seen anywhere! You don't have to leave the hotel: there's great European style outdoor lounge/bar, Reflections, and make reservations if you want to eat the hottest restaurant in Vancouver, Hawksworth, which says something in this city full of great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get any better”
Reviews.Author: omakase
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visit Vancouver twice a year for fun and relaxation. We have stayed in many of the lovely luxury hotels in the West End and downtown area. This past summer we had the opportunity to dine in Hawksworth, the highly ranked restaurant in the Hotel Georgia, Dinner was outstanding, but it also allowed us to see the beautiful lobby of the hotel and meet some of the friendly staff. Last week when it was time to choose an accommodation for our trip, we tried the Hotel Georgia. It just doesn't get any better! The hotel was built in the late 20's and recently renovated to bring back the decor and charm of that era but with the modern amenities expected today. The lobby is charming and warm with the hotel staff that make every guest feel welcome and special. The rooms are lush and beautiful with all the modern amenities including a beautiful marble bathroom with large walk-in shower with rain-shower head. The hotel also offers a full dining room, bakery and cafe, indoor salt water swimming pool, and new outdoor urban sitting area on the 4th floor to socialize with friends, have a drink and appetizers, and sit and look out over the roofs of the urban skyline. The space called "Reflections" had just opened while we were there, but it was already becoming a "happening place." If the weather is inclement, there is the option of the cozy bar and lounge off the lobby or just sitting in front of the flickering fireplace in the lobby itself. However the most delightful surprise of the stay was Jim, the hotel driver who would whisk you away to your dinner reservation or float plane in the luxurious Bentley. His friendly attention just made you feel so special and a valued guest. We now have a new favorite hotel in Vancouver and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Week end”
Reviews.Author: buffetred
Reviews.Content: What a nice Hotel, friendly staff, beautiful room, very nice swimming pool, had diner at their restaurant downstairs use their Bentley courtesy car to go for diner, over all a fantastic place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place”
Reviews.Author: Juhls524
Reviews.Content: You can't go wrong with Rosewood hotels- their service is always exceptional. The room was super big, yet cozy. And the bathroom...wow. I would definitely takes notes from them on design if I was remodeling a bathroom. Lighting, shower, bath- were all perfect. (Those are hard details to get perfect in a hotel.) Internet was flawless which should be an expectation in 2012, but I'm still surprised this isn't the case at some of the nicest hotels. Everyone who works here wants to help you so it really makes your travels effortless. The room service food was pretty good, but sometimes they forgot the little things such as sugar and milk with tea or water without ice. Very minor though and I'm sure if I called to let them know, they would have jumped to it quickly. I was here on business, but I would definitely bring my family here as a stop over to Whistler. It seemed there were a lot of travelers doing that.

Reviews.Title: “The Bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: glassviolin
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel! Two highlights -the amazing bathrooms & the service. We went for the deluxe room (one step above the basic superior room) because it came with a tub as well as a shower (superior is just a shower). And what a tub it was! It's a huge soaker. The shower is a beautiful walk-in with a rain-shower thing. Dual sinks, separate toilet room. The bathroom was the biggest I've seen in any hotel. And man, I do love a large bathroom :) The service was impressive. We came with a baby and two dogs -not your most desirable clientele. They didn't even bat an eye. In fact, they genuinely seemed pleased to have us all. We were heading to an appointment early the next day and the front desk folk went way out of their way to find us the shortest route. The room was beautiful (no signs of wear at all). Great bed, great sitting area. Lighting system (once figured out) was good. The location was ideal -right downtown. Although, we did have to circle the block a few times before finding the entrance (it is not a grand entrance). Overall, great experience. We felt like rockstars. We've recommended this hotel to many friends and we'll definitely stay here the next time we're in vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated, wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: DocBells
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been beautifully and carefully renovated and there has been attention paid to every little detail. I was in a deluxe room which was glorious - mainly for the bathroom, with the deep tub and separate rainfall shower, as well as heated floors. The rooms are smaller than some hotels (due to the historic building) but they are still charming and comfortable. The water and shortbread by the bed when I came in from dinner was particularly welcome. I dined with friends at Hawksworth restaurant and this is an experience not to be missed - fantastic local BC food with some twists - probably the best restaurant in Vancouver currently (and the full English breakfast even included black pudding and a small pot of baked beans - the nearest facsimile I have had in Canada!). The front of house staff were extremely helpful in every way. I am already looking forward to my next visit and trying the outdoor bar in warmer weather.

Reviews.Title: “This is THE place to stay in Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: coyone
Reviews.Content: My high expectations were exceeded on every level on every day of my stay. This hotel's facilities and staff were all excellent without being pretentious. The special rate the hotel offered for a junior suite made this an extraordinary deal and excellent value when a cot was set up in the living room for my teenage son. The location cannot be beat. The hotel's signature restaurant, Hawksworth, was not a highlight for us, but it was a good dining experience. (We did not love our meal at the highly-lauded restaurant West in Granville, either, but it was also good.) The fitness and pool facilities at the Hotel Georgia WERE highlights as they were very clean and new with attentive staff. I wish I had had the time to try the spa, Sense. Bel Cafe is worth a stop for any visitor downtown wanting a perfect cup of coffee. Don't miss the macaroons, including a bacon/maple flavor. Every staff member we met was cheerful and went beyond the norm to please. Even check-in and check-out were pleasant, thanks to Davi and others! We arrived at 10am to ask to check-in--hours before a room could be reasonably expected--and they apologized for the 15 minute wait to get the room ready (including setting up a comfy cot) and gave us macaroons! Unreal. While in Vancouver, I recommend: taking the Canada Line from the airport to the stop one block from the Hotel Georgia (buy a day pass from the 7-Eleven in the airport), renting bikes (Bayshore Bikes) for a 5+ mile, mostly level, ride around the perimeter of Stanley Park and along the sea wall, touring by seaplane with Harbour Air (we booked the Panorama Experience at the terminal which is near Canada Place), grazing on cheese and fruit at the Granville Public Market (take a mini-ferry for $3.50 one-way), schlepping out to the Museum of Anthropology ($30 taxi or easy bus ride), and shopping Alberni Street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Jill S
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Hotel Georgia. The atmosphere of the lobby and rooms was great. We were on the 11th floor and no complaint about noise from the street. Our room was smaller than expected, it was quite squishy once you get 3 people in plus luggage. My one big complaint would be that there were no hooks or towel bars in the bathrooms. I didn't have any where to hang my bathroom bag, or towels after we had used them. Also the heated floor was almost too hot, and you have to lie on the floor to adjust the temperature which is located under the bathroom counter. I know these seem like small things but at a hotel of this caliber you would expect attention to small details. The location is incredibly convenient and the customer service was super. We especially enjoyed our drink in the 1927 Lounge. I would stay here again, but look into getting a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “simply the best”
Reviews.Author: jonToronto
Reviews.Content: this is an old hotel that was perfectly renovated. The rooms are large and done wonderfully with great beds and TVs and lots of little extras. the service is great and the staff friendly and helpful. Not only is this my favorite in Vancouver but perhaps North America. wonderful

Reviews.Title: “simply amazing”
Reviews.Author: davis121
Reviews.Content: Hotel: Being a new hotel has its advantages. The decor is amazing with wood paneling almost everywhere but tastefully done. I couldnt fine a single flaw with the craftsmanship. Excellent carpenters. Room: A bit small but Im not complaining. Also wood paneling everywhere. Craftsmanship is excellent. Our room was at the end of the hall but still a short walk to the elevator. I never knew how much i would appreciate heated bathroom floors and ceiling rain showers until now. There isnt space for a DVD player but if you ask the concierge the engineer will gladly set one up for you. This helped when we utilized the DVD library for our daughter. Beds were comfortable as any hotel. We were on the 8th floor and couldnt hear any traffic from the street below. Location: Central and a short walking distance to almost anything. Across the street is Four Seasons and the mall and a block away is the Fairmont where we had afternoon tea. The convention center is less than 10 minute walk. London Drugs also a block away as well as Robson St. for shopping. Hawksworth Restaurant: Food was excellent but they seem to cater to the businees clientale more than families. We ate there twice but the next 3 days we ate at the Four Seasons Yew restaurant. Yew seemed to cater to our daughter and family more and the service of Four Seasons is seen in the restaurant. Fitness: Average size and there wasnt more than 3 other people whnever I was there. Pool is nice with changing lights. Jim the driver was excellent and our daughter loved him. Connie the concierge also excellent but they really all are excellent. What is most important to us when travelling to a foreign place (Canada not really foreign because we are from California) is a sense of security. We felt that if anything were to happen that every staff member would do more than necessary to solve the issue.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation was well thought-out”
Reviews.Author: rwg550
Reviews.Content: This hotel and staff are terrific! Some of things I liked: 1. HVAC. Many restaurants and hotels have the H and the AC but stumble on the Ventilation. A place with inadequate ventilation gets stuffy. Your ventilation system, as well as temperature control, worked great. 2. Rain shower - this was great. 3. Heated tile in the bathroom floor - wonderful! 4. Marble in the bathroom - counter, floor and shower areas. This was amazing - it had the rich texture of a fine marble but was not cold to the touch, was not slippery in the shower and in fact felt soft on the feet. 5. Flashlight in the closet for emergencies is a great idea and I've never seen this before in a hotel. 6. Closet areas were small but so well arranged with drawers and hanging space that I had plenty of room. 7. Expresso machine was great and got used a lot! 8. TV on the wall saves space. 9. Bed and bedclothes were very comfortable. I liked the idea of the gooseneck reading lamps on the headboard, although mine were not functional (or I couldn't find the switches). 10. I liked the hidden electrical outlets in the desk and nightstand. Very neat and practical in that I always have a bunch of chargers to plug in and many hotels don't seem to have enough outlets. 11. Staff - super nice and outgoing but not overbearing. Everyone would say "Hello" as they passed in the halls. David, who checked me in during the evening shift, was particularly helpful after my credit card was blocked and we had to reverse some things the next night after I got it cleared. 12. Not that anything is far in downtown Vancouver, but the location of the Rosewood was across the street from most of my business meetings. 13. Although I did not have dinner at the Hawksworth restaurant, several people told me it is among the best in town. I did have breakfast there and it was great. 14. I did use the Internet in the room. There is a two-tiered system and you can choose the higher priced one if you have more than one device for internet access. I had my laptop and iPhone but you could connect just the laptop in the room and use the free WiFi in the lobby to update emails on the iPhone every now and then. I use WiFi only for iPhone internet when travelling to avoid high cell data charges. There were many other conveniences and I would certainly stay at a Rosewood hotel again. Thank you for putting such thought into your accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel -- glitz, glamour and spectacular service!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveller30
Reviews.Content: This hotel was bar-none one of the best hotels that I have ever had the privilege of staying in. If you have read other reviews that I have written, you will know that I set a very high bar for service, quality and glamour if a hotel bills itself as a 4 or 5 star. The Rosewood did not disappoint -- if anything it far exceeded my expectations and has raised my bar for what is truly required in a hotel. Well done Rosewood! The Good: - The front desk staff were consummate professionals -- accommodating, friendly without being intrusive, incredibly knowledgeable, well-spoken and exuded class. I had the privilege of being served upon check-in by Cash. What a great individual and a true credit to the hotel. - Before I could even turn around from the front desk, there was a hotel staffer in a very nice suit who was there to put my bags on the cart and escort me to my room. He was just a friendly guy, again uber professional and a credit to the hotel. Upon arrival in my room, he asked if I needed anything and I said yes, that I would like some cigarettes (it's a nasty habit I have picked up whilst travelling... but I digress) and would he know where there was a store close by that I could pick some up at. He then informed me that part of the hotels service was to run errands for their guests. I gave him the money, he got my cigarettes for me -- all in about 10 minutes. Unreal. I was so impressed. - The rooms. Oh my gosh, the rooms. Beautiful BEAUTIFUL furnishings, a welcoming bed, a beautiful headboard, couches that looked like they were just bought, amazing armchairs, a desk that was high quality with not a scuff mark to be seen. The wardrobes lining the entry hallway were absolutely out of this world, ample room, quality hangers, an impressively stocked mini bar. - The service from the staff again was incredible - I needed my shoes polished and my suit pressed for a dinner I was attending. I called at 11pm. They picked up both and I had them back by 7am the next morning. Beautiful. - The food. Incredible. If you haven't been to Hawkesworth you simply must go. A fantastic experience in excellent food, beautiful wines and a classy atmosphere with - again - amazing staff. - The lounge just off the lobby is very "old money" and is absolutely a treat to be in. I can't say enough about it. It just makes you feel a cut above the rest. - The lobby, like the rest of the hotel, is absolutely stunning with well-appointed decor, attentive staff and exudes the 5-star experience that guests can/should expect from a hotel that bills itself as high quality. It is. In every respect. - The doormen. Again, unreal. From offering you water when you get in to a car, to calling your car service, to going out in the rain to flag down your car while you wait in the comfort of the lobby, these guys are second to none. I absolutely adored this hotel and can't wait until my next visit. Thank you Hotel Rosewood for setting the bar high -- and leaping over it! Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel, Terrific Location”
Reviews.Author: gpstevens
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at this beautiful hotel since its restoration. The location at Georgia and Howe is central to everything Downtown Vancouver has to offer. The rooms are modern, with high tech lighting, tv and internet, and with special touches on the night tables, coffee and refreshment bar, and the bathrooms are appointed to the highest standards. The Hawksworth Restaurant is trendy yet refined and the food and service excellent. Each staff member from the moment we met the door man, bellmen, valet parker, front desk and concierge was helpful and courteous and offered to assist us with anything we might need. We will be back. I cannot believe I am writing this but I place this hotel above any other hotel I have stayed in for service to its guests and responsiveness from its staff.

Reviews.Title: “A truly exceptional experience.”
Reviews.Author: Tamtamarama
Reviews.Content: From the moment I stepped out of my cab, the staff greeted me by name. I was fortunate to be able to stay for several nights, and had the opportunity to try Hawksworth Restaurant, Bel Cafe, 1927 Lounge, Reflections, and to attend an event in the Spanish Ballroom. Every interaction and experience exceeded my expectations. The attention to detail at Rosewood Hotel Georgia is incredible - each time I entered or left the hotel, again, the staff greeted me by name - that can't be easy to do in a busy hotel. I had friends and associates join me at the hotel for dinner, coffee or wine, and each of them also felt pampered and impressed with the level of service, quality of surroundings and experience. Even in the Bel Cafe, the server took the time to introduce himself and remembered me the next time I came in - and all I had was a cappuccino! The hotel room was sumptuous and extremely comfortable. Initially I had wished for a view out to the Art Gallery, but when I realized I was looking over the pool and Reflections, I was very pleased for the soothing sound of the water and the pretty courtyard below. Even as I was sadly leaving, the valet offered me a bottle of water for my drive. Sigh - I can't wait until I can visit again. The Rosewood Hotel Georgia is setting a new standard for service quality.

Reviews.Title: “Rosewood Georgia Outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: 123holly456
Reviews.Content: The Rosewood Hotel Georgia is the most beautiful hotel in Vancouver. The staff is outstanding and the hotel is kept in pristine condition. The rooms are a good size and very clean. This hotel is child friendly! There were many children in the hotel and they were treated very well in the adult environment. I would strongly recommend this hotel. Please find a few highlights from the hotel and team. Heather the concierge was exceptional. She was helpful and extremely kind. I should also note patient, because we had a few logistical issues and Heather handled them with a smile on her face the entire time! Connie was outstanding as well…she knew all of the good restaurants around town! Robert also was excellent; he helped us rent a car and find are way to important sites around Vancouver. I must make a HUGE shout-out to Jim the Bentley Driver and ‘goodwill ambassador’ of the Rosewood Georgia. What a beautiful person. He showed us the city and pointed out true gems of historical relevance. He could not have been nicer. I would suggest people stay at the Rosewood just to meet Jim! Hawksworth was absolutely delightful! We had the opportunity to meet Chad the GM, who came to our table and made sure our 12 year old daughter, was happy and enjoyed her meal. I expect that level of service for adults, but the time and care that Chad displayed for a younger patron was endearing. The Bel Café is a jewel in Vancouver! What a wonderful little café. First off the barista made a fantastic cup of coffee and he is a master of ‘foam decoration”. Parker was such a personable representative for the café and hotel. We stayed at the Rosewood for 6 days and Parker took the time to learn all of our names…and even remembered our order! In addition, Parker worked very hard to make sure that the tables and surrounding areas were exceptionally clean. A+

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: travellinpaddler
Reviews.Content: This is easily the best hotel I have had the pleasure of staying at. All of the modern conveniences, in a newly renovated property that has maintained all of the original architectural features. You never get tired of looking around at the beauty of the hotel including amazing original works of art. Probably the most amazing feature is the staff, however. They all seem to truly love being there too. They are professional and courteous but laid back at the same time. We felt so welcome. Beds are heavenly, the rainshowers were amazing! Cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: chillyp
Reviews.Content: The people that work at this hotel make you feel really special and the room itself is very luxurious. I've now stayed in almost every 5 star hotel in Vancouver and this is my new favourite ( Sorry Fairmont WF - It's me, not you. )

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!”
Reviews.Author: appleorchard
Reviews.Content: Our stay exceeded our expectations. We spent three lovely days at the hotel, and were delighted with hotel and the gorgeous restoration. The staff was outstanding, bar none. Our room was comfortable and cozy, and our stay was made more pleasant by the little details - the espresso machine in the room and a complimentary tea tray sent up every afternoon (upon our request). Kudos to the staff, especially Jim (the driver), Matthew, Connie & Heather (concierges), and John, the bartender at the lobby bar who graciously and creatively mixed me a cocktail based on my favorite ingredients, and shared his historical knowledge of cocktails. The heated floor in the bath was nice, as was the shower and the soaking tub. We have stayed at Rosewood properties before (Caneel & Little Dix) and this "big city" experience at the Hotel Georgia ranks right up there with them.

Reviews.Title: “Loved that Opulent Feeling!”
Reviews.Author: Angelita d
Reviews.Content: I treated myself to one night at the Rosewood Hotel Georgia after a few days at another hotel in Vancouver. And a treat it surely was! Highly recommended if you want to feel like royalty! I took advantage of an opening special they were running, only 300/nite for a Jr. suite which I thought was grrreat value! The rooms are exactly as they look on the website pictures. Truly classy and opulent :) I just wished I'd had the time to treat myself to a bath in that romantic-looking bath-tub. I called in advance to inquire about parking, and lo-and-behold, when I arrived at the hotel the front men and other hotel staff were expecting me and were addressing me by my last name! I must admit, I haven't been privy to such royal service before! It kind of creeped me out a little bit. Even when waiting for the elevator, staff members were asking me: 'How are you enjoying your stay Ms.____ ?' I think if I had travelled with company that would've been alright but when travelling solo I don't like to draw so much attention to myself ;) Still a fabulous hotel and I will consider returning in the right company :)

Reviews.Title: “One of the worlds best”
Reviews.Author: Steve B
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at the Rosewood Hotel Georgia and were beyond impressed. The accommodations, the hotel amenities and the unmatched service of the staff were first rate in every sense of the word. The front desk staff and the concierge all went above and beyond even what you would expect at a 5 star resort, and all with a warmth and genuine heart for service that made us marvel. The stellar service continued when we dined in their award winning Hawksworth restaurant for dinner and followed up with breakfast the next morning. We have stayed in luxury hotels around the world and would rate the Georgia in the top 2 along side the Crillon in Paris. The fitness center with their saltwater lap pool on the fourth floor was outstanding. It is located in the heart of Vancouver, with sites, shopping, great dining and art all within short walking distance. The staff directed us to some of the best sites to see in a two day visit and made our trip memorable. There is no better place to stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “When you visit Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: travelgoddess53
Reviews.Content: You MUST treat yourself to a stay at the Rosewood Hotel Georgia! Fabulous property and the service provided throughout the stay was impeccable! Terriific location in a wonderful city but be warned- you may never want to leave! The rooms themselves are so comfortable and the bathrooms were incredible! All other luxury hotels should take heed. Treat yourself to a visit to Senses-their spa- and you won't be disappointed. The time honored tradition of meeting for cocktails is alive and well and thriving at their Hawksworth Restaurant and Bar 1927. You must try the signature cocktail "Georgia" which has been dubbed "hotel history in a glass". Such fun! Their Bel Cafe seems to be the hot spot for the local crowd for breakfast and lunch. Great soups, artisnal sandwiches and to die for pastries. Try the new "cookies and cream" macaroon- worth every calorie. If you need to get around town, the hotel's own Bentley can take you there. Reservations are required and service is limited to within city limits. Cannot wait to return Vancouver and this wonderful hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTraveler_2008
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located out of the main stream of traffic, Hotel Georgia offers a lovely environment to enjoy Vancouver on business or pleasure. I first found the hotel on one of my business trips and am returning for a casual weekend with my spouse. We'll let you know how the weekend romance rating goes but for business, it was a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury meets sincere service”
Reviews.Author: MWiebe01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rosewood Hotel Georgia for our 25th wedding anniversary. At 45 & 44 years of age respectively - we are old enough to appreciate the finer things in life & young enough to still enjoy a good, slightly rowdy night on the town. The staff at this hotel were extremely professional but managed to combine that trait with a sincere desire to do anything in their power to add enjoyment to their guests stay. The ambience of the entire hotel is fantastic, and in particular the staff of the 1927 Lobby Lounge & the front desk personnel - were a true pleasure to interact with. We are fairly well travelled, and have had the opportunity to stay at a number of 1st class hotel around the world. However, the Rosewood Hotel Georgia definitely rose to the top of the ranks for both luxurious surroundings & top notch customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the nicest hotel I have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Nomad04
Reviews.Content: 5 Stars! The best of the best! I would highly recommend this hotel. I will return!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious week away in Vancouver. Simply the best.”
Reviews.Author: ElyseMikeB
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Vancouver. I stayed there on business, but would come back with friends or a romantic stay. It was the best hotel experience I have ever had. The service was incredible and very attentive, always addressed by name. The rooms were luxurious, large in size. My favourite part was the bathroom with the oversized tub, rain shower and heated marble floor (amazing). I took a dip in the pool at 9pm, which was lovely. Very clean, and felt like I was in a resort. Location was central. You must try the Coffee at Bel Cafe...I became addicted. Hawksworth lived up to it's name. Great atmosphere, and mouthwatering food. I wish I had more time to try the Spa! Until next time.......

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in western North America.”
Reviews.Author: JeffandRenee
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we pulled into the parking area and the valet greeted us warmly. He directed us to the very private and unassuming entrance off of the garage and into a beautifully adorned and well layed out lobby. No less than three friendly and helpful people attended to us as we checked Iin and we were shown to our room on the 10th floor. The room was perfect. A unique layout with modern decor inviting us to be comfortable and feel great. Amazing view of the art gallery and city. The heated floors in the marble tiled bathroom were a treat, and the deep soaker tub made for the ultimate in relaxation after a busy day of car travel. The big screen HD tv was a nice touch as was the lobby area of the room that allowed us to keep the rest of the room free of clutter. A small fridge, a fun espresso machine and wonderful linens highlighted the obvious depth of thought that went into room features. The spa, pool, and exercise room made for a comfortable experience and allowed us to enjoy the morning in privacy and style. Overall, the quality of the room, the service staff, and the amenities in the hotel are the best we have experienced in our travels!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend stayvacation”
Reviews.Author: Boundary_Bay1967
Reviews.Content: Simply the best - Exemplar service, exemplar attention to detail, exemplar accommodations and exemplar staff. Location could not be better. Unique in that the renovations spared no expenses in rescuing back all glamour, taste and experience of a bygone era without incorporating any of the negative common side-effects found in many of other glamour rescue attempts. Spotless clean and the food is marvelous independent of where you chose to eat. Location is fantastic. Valet parking is expensive @ 39% of the price of the room, especially for the non-Bentley weekender like me looking for an escape, but you can just park underground across the street and problem solved. This is a hotel that I will keep coming back and I will recommend to anyone who is interested in knowing how things should be done in the hospitality world.

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious weekend”
Reviews.Author: carrier_ca
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. The rooms are very comfortable and tastefully appointed. The bathrooms are exceptional, soaker tubs, rainfall showers, and heated tile floors. We enjoyed both dinner and breakfast in the restaurant (make sure you make reservations for dinner). The spa treatment was very personalized and the spa is really cozy and comfortable. The gym is beautiful, great equipment and a nice big stretching area. Only downside was the limited movie selection, but this was easily off-set by the streaming capabilities on our iPad. We had a great weekend getaway and would definitely do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver's Finest”
Reviews.Author: Oliver H
Reviews.Content: I've been fortunate enough to have traveled to Vancouver many times over the past few years, and have stayed in some excellent hotels in this city including- The Four Seasons, The Opus, Loden, Shangri-La. The Rosewood Hotel Georgia is hands down my favorite hotel, not just in Vancouver, but probably in the world (and I have been to many cities). The rooms are amazing. Very good size, appointed to the highest standards, and with an amazingly comfortable bed. The staff cant do enough to help you, very attentive and always courteous. The hotel dining facilities are first class. The gym and salt water pool were sensational! Overall I really cant rate this hotel enough. Vancouver is lucky to have many wonderful hotels, but the Rosewood Hotel Georgia is in my opinion the best. I cant wait for my next trip to Vancouver where i'll certainly be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A real treat in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: rozinwa
Reviews.Content: Came for a business meeting, will return for pleasure. Beautiful room, very quiet, great location, wonderful service by hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Y0rkieAbr0ad
Reviews.Content: From the point we arrived to the time we left, this Hotel displayed a professional and efficient service. The rooms were of a good size and presented a quality finish. The staff were friendly and knowledgeable. We visited the Hotel for our anniversary and the little extra touches made the whole experience unforgettable. The breakfast is a menu choice with a quality that speaks for itself. In short this place understands the finer points of running a Hotel, we shall be back.

Reviews.Title: “Just a quick stay”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Georgia and it was an amazing experience. Our meetings were well looked after, the food provided was of excellent quality. The restaurant was very good as well. The reons of the hotel were nicely done with the charm of the original building kept, but all the modern convenience added. The staff is some of the best I have ever seen. I've stayed in a number of fine hotels/resorts because of my work, and this ranks at or very near the top of my list. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Smelling of roses”
Reviews.Author: Gofflet
Reviews.Content: A perfect hotel... 3 nights (for the price of 2,so an absolute bargain) Hits -, huge comfortable beds with lovely sheets ,Jimmy the Bentley driver, lovely pool with excellent gym, biscuits at bedtime, fabulous artwork in the foyer Misses-none

Reviews.Title: “One of the Finest Hotels in North America”
Reviews.Author: hank m
Reviews.Content: Perfect on all accounts. We spent 4 nights at the Hotel Georgia in November 2011, and would recommend the hotel to anyone and everyone. Hotel is essentially brand new after a 4 year renovation. No expense was spared. Rooms are fantastic. And the bathrooms even better. Luxury everywhere. Hotel staff was some of the most helpful I have ever encountered. Imagine being driven to your evening dinner in the hotel's own Bentley! Hotel restaurant one of the best in the city too. Spa is great. Exercise facility top notch. Indoor Pool amazing! Perfect location for seeing Vancouver. 5 Star rating is not high enough! HM

Reviews.Title: “A superb stay”
Reviews.Author: Jody05
Reviews.Content: I felt completely spoiled right from the start of my stay, through to the end. James was supremely attentive, showing me the lobby details while I waited at the check in counter, arranging for the hotel's Bentley to take me to my important interview the next day, and then showing me the details of my room. The room was beautiful, the heated bathroom floor, closets that lit up from within on opening, and the Nespresso machine were real treats. I had a small glitch with my TV turning on in the middle of the night waking me up, when I mentioned it to the staff they suspected a snag with the technology settings in the room and were going to look into it upon my departure. I'm confident they'd ensure it doesn't happen to future guests but in addition, it would have been nice if they'd just said they were sorry for my disrupted sleep just to show they cared. But truly, besides that, it was my best ever hotel experience with the service being the best I've ever had. A big thank you to James for making my stay such a delight.

Reviews.Title: “The Rosewood Georgia is top notch, the very best stay we've ever had!”
Reviews.Author: Bettysally
Reviews.Content: From the moment we drove in we felt like VIP. Brian and Lane were awesome, they both went above and beyond what anyone would expect. The front desk staff and concierge was always polite and ready to assist. The building is gorgeous! The beds are the most comfortable I've ever slept in. Love the Nespresso machine in the room. We will definatly be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Old School Elegance”
Reviews.Author: SND72
Reviews.Content: Not only was the room exquisite, the textures, colours and lighting beautiful, but it was so logically appointed! The bed is beautiful and comfortable. The bathtub was a dream, as was the shower(Of course, they have radiant heated floors.)! The toilet is separate, which, with the sliding glass doors closed, is blessedly very private. The recent move to all glass open concept bathrooms in many hotels, boutique and otherwise, often overlooks this most basic necessity. The staff went above and beyond the call of duty. The door man walked me to the sky train station, trolleyed my bag for me the whole way and refused a tip! The gals at the help desk made a hair appointment for me. We had an absolutely magnificent meal at the restaurant, and I enjoyed a gorgeous bowl of chicken broth soup at the little cafe, it had some fresh lemon and green beans (that were not overlooked) added just at the end. Delicious! I would travel half as often, so that I may afford the Georgia. It is totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property”
Reviews.Author: 2surly
Reviews.Content: I was only in Vancouver for 1 night for a tradeshow at the Rosewood Hotel Georgia, and because they were offering a special rate, I canceled my reservation at the Metropolitan and re-booked at the Hotel Georgia. The location is fantastic, just 1/2 block from the metro/Skytrain station from the airport. Room was very spacious, but the bathroom was the best: separate tub and shower (always a plus in my book), with heated floors. Didn't sleep well but that had more to do with my raging insomnia than the room, and staff was exceptional, very courteous and efficient. I'd definitely go back if they ever offer a rate that's within my company's travel policy.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Aces999
Reviews.Content: The washrooms are huge and they have great technology in the room

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Staff, incredible experience.”
Reviews.Author: gypsy71
Reviews.Content: Went to Vancouver for a weekend getaway and stayed the the Rosewood Hotel Georgia based solely on Tripadvisor reviews. Our experience was incredible! I have traveled all over the world and have not experienced service of this caliber in quite a lone time. From the ease of the valet at check in, the warmth and professionalism of the front desk, the knowledge of the concierge, the friendliness of the bellman, and the absolutely wonderful hospitality of the hotel driver who took us all over. This hotel bar has superb bartenders and an incredible cocktail list with wonderful ambiance. The Hawthorne restaurant was an amazing treat for brunch and again with incredible service. The rooms were very classy and tastefully done with large heated marble floor tiles, and a sunken in bath. Everything was top of the line throughout the hotel. Worth every penny, and I wouldn't stay anywhere else in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Sublime...”
Reviews.Author: BlackRock09
Reviews.Content: Truly an amazing experience. As I turned each corner in the suite I was thoroughly impressed. I kept saying over and over again.. they have thought of everything. If you want to treat yourself to a wonderful Vancouver hotel experience - this is it! Elegant, modern and beautiful. I was equally impressed that the older structural elements were maintained on the property. They have been incorporated so gracefully with the modern decor and amenities. Thank you Rosewood... I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “A gem”
Reviews.Author: TouristBee
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend here with my husband after a week of skiing in Whistler. Excellent friendly, attentive and personal service from the moment you pull up at the front door. James, who showed us to the room made sure to settle us in comfortably and brought us up a pot of tea right away. The staff greets you by name every time they see you and is always ready to help. The room was very comfortable and had luxe decor but a bit small and not much closet/storage space but this was well compensated by a lovely big bathroom with heated marble floors and a roomy bathtub, (great to soak the aching post skiing muscles in) and a fabulously comfortable bed. Location couldn't have been more convenient- all the shops, bars, restaurants are a stones throw away. Complimentary Bentley hotel car service within downtown with an extremely friendly and warm driver Jim was a nice touch. Valet service always had our rental car ready by the door and stocked with fresh bottled water before we stepped out The pool and spa looked great. Everything in this hotel is new, polished and clean but with just the right touch of old school glamour and luxury. Highly recommended. This hotel lives up to all its great reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service and ambience”
Reviews.Author: Peter3801
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Georgia for one night to finish off our visit to Canada. The hotel is beautiful with old school decor in the foyer, and modern but incredibly comfortable and tasteful decor in our room. The room lighting and IT controls were great, and the bathroom had the most wonderful ceiling mounted "rainfall" shower head - pure bliss. Our bed had a pillow top mattress, something about which I am usually dubious as I find them too soft but as it was I slept very well. The pillows were perfect and not too soft. The hotel also honoured our request for the bed to be made up with a regular blanket and sheets (and not a duvet). The windows of the room could be opened and therefore we didn't need to keep the a/c on while sleeping to keep the room at a comforable (cooler) temperature for sleeping. We had pre-dinner drinks at 1927 and the barman was knowledgable and capable and mixed my martini exactly as I like it. We dined at Hawksworth restaurant and had a meal of brilliant quality with fresh local produce showcased perfectly - David Hawksworth's food is intelligent but not fussy and focuses on the quality of the produce and its flavour. It was easy to have three courses with wine and not feel over-full. Everything was delicious but a particular highlight was the short ribs first course. Beef short ribs cooked sous vide for 48 hours produced strongly flavoured and meltingly tender meat and the seasonings were Thai-inspired but without any sweet notes which worked perfectly with the rich meat. We paired this with the sweetbreads and this was the right combination as the glaze on the sweetbreads was quite sweet but was a perfect balance against the sour/salty/hot of the short ribs.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in downtown Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: auroranyc1
Reviews.Content: I'll try to keep my review short and sweet. My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a week for our birthdays. As you may know, the Rosewood hotels email you a guest preference form to book special services; e.g Spa services, dinner reservations, reason for your stay/if you are celebrating any event.. etc. I had mentioned we will be visiting for our birthdays but didn't specify anything more or less. When we arrived we were greeted by Brian which was so nice (also helpful during our entire stay). Connie at the reception desk, wished us "Happy Birthday" and we thought it was such a nice gesture! Later on that day, we received a birthday cake with a card from the manager - which they didn't have too - but to go that extra step, what a great way to treat your guests. Also our last night in town, we had booked a reservation at the hotels' restaurant "Hawksworth" which again on our deserts, they wrote "happy birthday" on them once more. Very nice touch! Rooms: We stayed in room 911 - which gives a view of the Pacific Centre. Spacious room, comfortable bed and pillows, loved the heated bathroom floors! Nice size shower - all around great room for your getaway. Hotel staff: I don't know and remember everyone name but trust me when I say: everyone on staff is so cordial and nice - and go above and beyond to make sure everything is perfect! Everyone knew us by name by the first day. The staff is all so pleasant and sweet! Matthew the concierge was helpful when planning our day trip to Whistler. The hotel offers complimentary Bentley car service, to drive you around in the downtown area and Jim (the driver) was great to us as well. He gave us a mini tour of Gastown and surroundings areas which was great! Last but not least, we asked Celina who works at the bar if she recommends a good restaurant, she said she didn't remember the name of a particular restaurant, so she told us she would text her boyfriend and get back to us. Long story short: when we got back from dinner that night, we found an envelope at our door, with a note from her and directions to the restaurants she recommended. I'm telling you, everyone goes above and beyond to make sure your stay is perfect! And everyone really did make us feel at ease and welcomed. The hotel itself: Located downtown therefore walking distance to many great shops and the Pacific Centre Mall is footsteps from the hotel. The famous 'Caffe Artigiano' is right around the corner from the hotel (btw great coffee!). It is also walking distance to Canada Place, Gastown etc. I did not try the fitness center but my husband enjoyed it. Would of loved to try the spa, perhaps on our next visit! The bar has great cocktails. Beautiful and classy hotel. Overall, great location, great staff, beautiful rooms - a must if staying in downtown Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at its finest!!”
Reviews.Author: gibsonsmolly
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a glorious two night stay at the Hotel Georgia. This hotel is impeccable!! I used to live in Vancouver and was always sad to see them tear down the old buildings downtown to replace them with glass and steel. So to walk in to the lobby of this hotel and see the beautiful restoration was wonderful. Old world charm meets modern day luxury. The attention to detail is amazing. Everything has been planned with the comfort of the guest in mind. The rooms are spacious and soooooo soothing. The luxurious bathroom with its heated floors, stand alone tub and glass walled rainshower is bigger than some hotel rooms I have stayed in. The service absolutely exceeded my expectations. Warm and genuine from everyone I encountered. I cannot remember when I felt so valued as a customer. The bar off the restaurant and the coffee shop are both great places to have a drink and people watch. They both attract a lot of locals and have a great vibe. I didn't get to experience the restaurant but local friends tell me the food is very good. For me this is the best location in Vancouver. Close to absolutely everything. For a medium budget I still love the St Regis. It offers great value for the price. But if you are looking for luxury you will find nothing better in Vancouver than the Rosewood Hotel Georgia. Worth every single cent!!!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: lotstoseeanddo
Reviews.Content: we stayed for two nights on the 14th and 15th january. check in was really smooth and fast, our room was just gorgeous - a decent size with a wonderful, really luxurious bathroom. the bed was a king size and was extremely comfortable but the pillows were magnificent! we didnt eat at the hotel but asked the concierge for advice. Connie was extremely helpful and knowledgeable and sent us to the Cafe Medina for breakfast which was great. we each had a massage. the spa area is very good and our masseure, Chito, was the best we have ever come across. none of this stroking and poking but a properly trained, knew what she was about, masseure. make sure you use the complimentary stretch Bentley which will take you about the downtown area. Jim the driver was great. My only complaint is that they charged to use Wifi. with the sort of prices you pay for staying this was a bit mean. having said that i would make this our hotel of choice and wouldnt even try any of the others because i dont believe they could top the Georgia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: gz2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the newly renovated Rosewood Hotel Georgia from January 12-15th (today!) for a weekend get away. What an amazing experience! - Our check in was flawless. Even though we arrived at almost 1am, Navi (sp? at the front desk) and Steven (at the bell desk) were extremely helpful. Navi recommended that we upgrade to a junior suite (for $25 per night extra, what a steal!). Steven gave us a tour of the room (heated granite floors in the restroom, amazing!). - Every time we called the front desk or the concierge, they were more than happy to assist us. - We never once had an issue with noise - Upon check out and as we were about to request for a cab to be called for us, a nice gentleman (Jim the amazing Rosewood Georgia Hotel Bentley driver) told us to catch the sky train. He walked us to the train station which was a good 5 minutes away, waited till we purchased our transfers, walked us to the actual train station, AND waited until we boarded the train!!! Who does that?! We kept trying to tip him but he wouldn't accept. Not only does this hotel have amazing and luxurious rooms it also has phenomenal people that truly care about the hotel guests. We'll definitely be back! Thank you Rosewood Hotel Georgia!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Jan N
Reviews.Content: A totally positive experience, the room was very comfortable, modern and functional. The staff at check in, and for services were exceptionally responsive and knowledgeable. The very pleasing ambiance was an utterly positive surprise, from the Lobby, the Bars and Restaurants to the Room. Probably the best hotel I have stayed in for 30 years of extensive business and recreational travel in North America.

Reviews.Title: “The standard!”
Reviews.Author: MusicManTexas
Reviews.Content: Hotel Georgia is the standard by which I will judge all hotels. From the staff to the exquisite refurb, everything was amazing. If you are on the fence about where to stay, bite the bullet.....you'll thank me later.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: ming m
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel exuding a charming and elegant old-world quality. The rooms are beautiful and just as depicted from the photos on the website. The service is outstanding - everyone we interacted with, from the bellhop to the the fitness centre staff were friendly and professional. The bartender (Derek) at the hotel lounge was attentive and friendly and clearly knows his mixology! They knew we were celebration a birthday and the manager had a beautiful chocolate cake sent up for us - a lovely gesture on behalf of the hotel. My only complaint would be about the limited range and choice of the room service menu, and the moderate quality of the food (too salty and arrived lukewarm). For in-room dining at an establishment like this, I would have expected nothing short of superior. Nevertheless, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous make-over”
Reviews.Author: Adrienne C
Reviews.Content: We booked two adjoining rooms: wonderfully well appointed, generously stocked. All hotel staff fantastic. Room service prompt, courteous and caring. Bar staff very attentive. Excellent French Martinis! Service in restaurant somewhat tentative and food mediocre. However, on the whole, this small glitch was offset by a team of pro hoteliers who know how to treat their guests without missing a beat.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing stay...”
Reviews.Author: likebeingatourist
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic renovation of the old Hotel Georgia! We stayed in a Junior Suite and the room was beautiful. The layout of the room was very well thought out. The living/dining/bar area was not too big but large enough to entertain a small group(4-6) and this left room for a luxurious bed & bath area and even a small walk in closet. The bathroom was beautifully appointed - large walk-in shower with rain shower head, 2 sinks/vanities, a separate toilet and the piece de resistance - a gorgeous soaker tub. Guests are provided with full size shampoo/lotion/bath salts so no more running out of bath products from tiny bottles. The bed was exceedingly comfortable with great pillows and bedding. The photographs on the hotel website are an accurate depiction of the rooms. We were very impressed with the service from all levels of the staff. The Hotel Georgia offers a perfect location combined with beautiful rooms, excellent service and extras like a spa, an outdoor patio and car service. We will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Rosewood - excellent refurbished hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrianHoban
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night only - excellent staff and location. Lovely room - obviously new - great nespresso coffee in the room - what a bonus - better than the 10c cent drip stuff we had in the next 5 star hotel we stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Richard M
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated hotel with beautiful rooms, very comfortable and spacious. Overall architecture and interior design is gorgeous. Great location at the heart of the City, close to a multitude of interesting places to visit and shop. Can't wait for the Patio area to reopen in the spring.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: Jane M
Reviews.Content: They've done an amazing job of renovating this hotel. Everything is just gorgeous and very good quality. The bathrooms are great with a huge bathtub. The bed was the most amazing I've ever slept on. Service was also very good. I'd love to stay here again and would recommend it in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Top marks in all categories”
Reviews.Author: munster07
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights last weekend, making use of the '3rd night free' deal which is great value for money. The service levels in at the Georgia are the best I have experienced. Our every need was attended to. The location is the best available in my opinion. Right at the heart of the city. Once you step out the door everything is right there. The rooms are also of the best quality. The bathrooms are the best I have seen. We stayed on the 10th floor facing the art gallery which I recommend as the best view. Overall, I hope I have the opportunity to stay here again in the future

Reviews.Title: “Rosewood is Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Cuthanks
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rosewood last night as the sleep-over part of a Company Christmas dinner at La Terrazza in Vancouver. I had googled the Rosewood prior to getting to the hotel and was a little blown away by all of the amazing praise it was receiving. Could this hotel really be that nice?? Answer: ABSOLUTELY!!!!!! From the moment we arrived to the moment we departed, my wife and I have never been so well treated at a hotel and its staff. From Jordan helping us with bags to Jim giving us a ride home in the Bentley from our dinner. The room was luxurious, the bed was paradise, nice heated tile bathroom floors with a soothing rain-shower. Thick, fluffy white towels and robes. Beautiful flat screen TV - very cool lighting though I must admit that I was a little intimidated in the early hours of the morning with selecting the right button without my glasses. Lots of power, wireless. We finished off with a jaw-droppingly great breakfast at the Hawksworth restaurant - I'm still salivating. Earlier my wife and I wandered down to the lobby to get a coffee and were directed warmly to the lounge area where free coffee and newspapers were provided. We plunked ourselves down into the comfortables lounge chair/couch and got our day off in the nicest way. All staff were courteous and so very friendly - it really felt like the staff truly cared and really want to be nice. No fake stuff here - just really nice folks. The two other couples that joined us for the night here all agreed over breakfast that we didn't want to leave and have to find an excuse to come and stay again. Trust us, we will be looking hard. Thanks so much to everyone at the Rosewood. Folks, if you're reading this, it's ALL TRUE. Can't wait to get back here. Please, please don't change!! Congratulations and Merry Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Too High Teck”
Reviews.Author: dollysadie
Reviews.Content: My stay was ok considering they could not get my radio to work in my room. Such high teck equipment that it became work to figure it all out. The pool area was fabulous but no jaccuzzi. The non alcohol drinks they offered in the lounge were new and amazing. Freash squeezed blue-berry juice, soda and lavender. You died and went to heaven and God gave you a welcome drink! The menu for food and drinks at this hotel are more advanced and futuristic than anything I have experienced in LA 5 star hotels. The Bentley driver Jim was my fav as he drove us to dinner and other places. Nice touch with the hotel car. But then again it is supposed to be a 5 star. It is worth a stay and the staff were wonderful. Very friendly as apposed to the stuck up ( God only knows why) Canadians that were at the hotel, all New Yorking on everyone, with their noses in the air. Mostly women. Maybe they were uptight because there are never any good looking men in Vancouver. I was born and raised in vancouver so I know of what I speak. Any hoo, go and stay there if you get the chance, it's worth the experience, and if you are a nice looking gentleman you can probably have your pick of the beautiful stuck up Canadian women. Me included!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Serge555
Reviews.Content: For anyone visiting Vancouver this is the place to stay. We were there during the Grey Cup and I would have preferred to stay in my room the entire weekend! The room was fantastic, the bed was amazing (we are in the process of buying it). The hotel staff were courteous, friendly and professional. They were extremely helpfull when looking for dining options as well as providing us with the information to purchase the bed. Amazing hotel, amazing location, we look forward to staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best we've stayed in in some time”
Reviews.Author: gasmanincanada
Reviews.Content: Just stayed this month. Beautiful renovation. The rooms are very comfortable, well thought out, and luxurious. The staff are simply the best that have ever looked after us. We plan on returning soon and at the moment I can't imagine staying anywhere else in downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Intuitive service and they live up to it.”
Reviews.Author: Lori V
Reviews.Content: I've stayed twice at the Hotel Georgia since its re-opening and can't imagine I've ever had better service, a friendlier reception, and been made to feel as pampered and appreciated anywhere else in my life. I generally sleep poorly while away from home, but the comfortable beds, quiet ambience, cleanliness and luxury appointments of the room and the attitude and attentive service of the staff made me feel safe, secure and well able to sleep soundly. The staff all deserve special recognition- they really were intuitive, reading my needs well and anticipating my desires often before I even had to ask. This hotel made my business trip a true pleasure and better than some of the vacations I've had.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JKiefer
Reviews.Content: Lovely historic hotel that has been beautifully renovated. Clean, comfortable, and centrally located. Free wi-fi and great in room coffee. Also, very soft beds (pillow top). Staff was pleasant and helpful when asked, but did not really anticipate your needs and learn your name as is the case with most higher end hotels. Some of the small details were missing – but perhaps that is just because it is under new ownership. Their current service level does not refelct the price. Pool and gym facilities were great – but no hot tub or sauna which would be nice on the chilly, wet Vancouver days.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot recommend enough - puts 4 Seasons to shame”
Reviews.Author: Brian T
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Rosewood Hotel Georgia in downtown Vancouver, and was really bowled over by the customer service and overall luxuriousness of the hotel. My boyfriend and I were treated like celebrities, from the moment we arrived. The hotel offers a complimentary car (a Bentley) to take you around Vancouver; the driver could not have been nicer. The room was very elegant, and the true highlight was the bathroom - heated floors(!), amazing four spigot rain shower head (!) -- I could move into that bathroom! On the same trip, we traveled to Whistler and stayed at the 4 Seasons. While our room was bigger, it was not nearly as nice or special as our room in Rosewood, and the customer service couldn't compare. Would def recommend the Hotel Georgia to anyone travelling to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in years”
Reviews.Author: travell66
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed from the minute we stepped in till we left. The building and staff were exceptional. NOT one problem during the whole stay. I will return again and again. The pool was perfect for relaxation, perfect ambient temperature, perfect pool temperature and the salt water was soothing.
