Reviews.Title: “Surpassed every expectation.”
Reviews.Author: Tlingo
Reviews.Content: I have never experienced a hotel like this before. Every detail is meticulously thought out. The hotel staff are the true shining stars of this exceptional hotel, but that doesn't mean the building itself disappoints either. Employees are genuinely proud of where they work and it shows. The roomwas perfect The bathroom with enormous tub and bath salts, was a special treat, as was nightly turn down with fresh shortbread. The technology in the room (Bose sound system, Sony tv, and nespresso coffee, as well as perfect lighting for every need with convenient labelled one touch switches where you need them. (I hate fumbling around trying to figure out how to turn on a lamp... This is what I mean by every detail. You an even review a paperless copy of your room statement on the hotel menu integrated into your tv. The pool and fitness facilities leave nothing lacking either. With full gym and a heated salt water pool out of architectural digest. Everyone goes the extra mile to make you feel welcome, not in an overbearing hotel service kind of way, though. It's hard to explain but you leave this hotel feeling replenished, pampered, and part of a special secret, now that you know you won't stay anywhere else when you visit this incredible city. My husband and I stayed for two nights on our honeymoon. We are so grateful to everyone that made our time at the Hotel Georgia so memorable. The only hesitation I have in recommending this special place is I don't want it to be sold out next time I get to return!

Reviews.Title: “be pampered”
Reviews.Author: mex2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous the staff made us feel like like we were royalty the bathroom in our room was perfect heated floors and a giant soaker tub. This hotel is certainly worth the money though it is more then we would normally spend it was a great value pamper yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Rosewood Hotel on Georgia has it all!!!”
Reviews.Author: edward p
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely time at the Rosewood Hotel. It is a very beautiful and elegant hotel. The pool is amazing, the rooms are amazing and the location is perfect. The hotel staff was the nicest they could be. Very gracious and very accommodating. The service was outstanding. In fact, the Bentley driver was extraordinary. I think he made our trip. Dudley was his name, and he went out of his way to show us all the beautiful spots in Vancouver. He is the perfect chauffeur like you would imagine, in a movie. I don't know what they are paying him there but it's not enough. Me and my family have never felt more welcomed and special . . . Thank you Jim!!! Best part of our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel”
Reviews.Author: LAS_50
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel recently lovingly restored. Rooms are beautiful with every detail considered, staff are wonderfully attentive. Would highly recommend.might be the nicest hotel I have stayed at

Reviews.Title: “business stay”
Reviews.Author: Andy R
Reviews.Content: In an age of almost expected mediocrity, I was floored by this hotel. I travel on business and I can say that this hotel is a cut above the rest. The staff are genuinely warm and pleasant, not drippingly patronizing as I often see. They care about your stay. The room, the food, the staff, the amenities, WOW

Reviews.Title: “We came to Vancouver from England for a family wedding”
Reviews.Author: Michael W
Reviews.Content: The bridegroom chose this hotel. It was absolutely superb, from the decor, facilities and comfort levels to the friendliness and superb service from the staff. We have no hesitation in giving an unqualified recommendation for our stay

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Service Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Fisch78
Reviews.Content: I wish I could be pampered like this every day!!! The hotel is beautiful overall, the bathrooms in the rooms are fabulous, the bed was as comfy as they come, the drinks at the Hawksworth were delicious...and being driven around in a Bently isn't bad either!!! We went for a little getaway for my boyfriends birthday and after we arived back to our room our first night out they had left him a birthday cake. Connie, the concierge, happily took care of everything we ever needed including follow up phone calls and cards to make sure everything went ok. I can't say enough good things about this hotel...if we ever make it back to Vancouver this is DEFINITELY where we will stay!! Oh, and the location couldn't be better for access to all the areas of downtown Vancouver (and public transit)!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel In Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Kyle U
Reviews.Content: If you are coming to visit Vancouver or just getting away for a night or two (which is what we have done), the Rosewood Hotel Georgia is unquestionable the best hotel in the City - you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding property and great service”
Reviews.Author: CostaJohn
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many, many hotels around the world and this place compares favorably to all of them. The recent remodel was exceptional. Hotel with character but all of the benefits of a new, modern design. The service was truly exceptional and rates up there with the best of the hotels. Conceirge was extremely friendly and helpful. Nice having a Bentley to drive you to your dinner reservation and Jim, the driver, was great....... I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with terrible soundproofing”
Reviews.Author: Cocodela
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel as a weekend getaway. Wanted a great place to sleep in, that had a great bath and just do nothing for two days. Unfortunately that was not the case. The hotel is beautiful and the price is as I would expect for the this class of hotel, the lobby is grand and inviting although the floor lights at the check in desk are absolutely blinding and should have been done with a frosted glass instead of the clear lenses that they used. I had to place my luggage on them so that I could see across the desk. My room (deluxe) was stunning, great linens, and the the tub for two is a perfect way to spend a few hours on a cold Vancouver day. As far as the room itself there are only two things I would change, first the tv is a little small for a room his size so watching movies in bed is a little tough. And the reading lights on the bed don't work so you can't sty up and read without disturbing the person next to you. The teeny flaws in the room could easily be overlooked if it wasn't for how loud this hotel is. Even with the windows closed you could here all of the street noise which might not have been so bad if the Occupy Vancouver protest wasn't going on. I barely slept and when I did was woken up early to the sound of drums. I stay in Vancouver often and always like to try new hotels in the downtown but don't remember any of them being as loud as this one.

Reviews.Title: “More than a lucky break... fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dave67109
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write hotel reviews but this was truly one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. Stumbled onto this hotel when I needed to book last minute accommodations for a medical conference a few blocks away. The conference hotel was booked so I surfed around and read the great reviews of the Rosewood Hotel Georgia. The reviews did not do it justice... this place is fantastic! Was pleasantly surprised to arrive with a upgraded room with a soaker tub. Staff was over the top friendly and approachable, and extremely helpful with any inquiries. For a hotel of its size, it has maintained its warm boutique feel, and the staff seemed to always know your name each time you came and went. The rooms were simply spectacular, and I was so glad that I wasn't able to stay at the conference hotel down the street, as nice as that was. Even better since I found an online deal for $155/night with the 3rd night free, and I stayed three nights. Can't imagine anything of comparable quality that would even come close to that in all of Vancouver. Easy access directly to and from the airport with the Sky Train (~25 mins). Spectacular lobby, spotless, quiet hallways, and absolutely beautiful rooms. The espresso coffee machines in the rooms made for a wonderful way to start each day. I will certainly be back to the Rosewood Georgia the next time I am in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: Marla62
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a stay at the Rosewood Georgia Hotel in Vancouver, B.C. I don't think I have to tell anyone what an amazing city Vancouver is...but I just had to write about the Hotel. It is totally state of the art. It took my breath away. It oozes with the utmost of elegance. I have stayed in some beautiful hotels in Europe and New York...but they did not compare to the Rosewood Georgia in so many ways. Wish I could have stayed longer..... Marla

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: A_regular_traveler57
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively – for business and pleasure – and have stayed at hotels of the calibre of the Rosewood Hotel Georgia all over the world. My recent stay at this property was exemplary! From the moment I drove in, the doormen were welcoming, the Front Desk staff professional and hospitable and the Concierge went beyond his duty to secure me a table at Hawksworth at a time when the restaurant was over-subscribed already! The suite was inviting and the bed – quite honestly - I didn’t want to get out of it! Without exception, the staff were trained to the max. Congratulations! I look forward to staying at the Rosewood Hotel Georgia again soon (on a personal level) and recommending highly recommending property to my business clients as well.

Reviews.Title: “Five star at its best!”
Reviews.Author: SagMoonTravels
Reviews.Content: Absolutely stunning – five star at its best! The décor and attention to detail is superior and it is perfectly located in downtown Vancouver to maximize your experience. The quality of the staff is what I believe makes this hotel extra-special – they are friendly, vibrant and professional and each person goes out of their way to make you feel welcome. The rooms are spacious and beautifully decorated – one feels completely pampered. I especially loved the Nespresso machine in the bedroom and the luxurious bathroom with heated marble floors, top quality toweling and robes. Not to mention the his and hers vanity and the rain forest showerhead. The room has pretty much everything you could ask for. The art in the hotel is worth pausing for, especially the 3D painting in the foyer (amazing!). The dark wood and marble surrounds adds to the luxurious atmosphere and the salt water pool is incredible. The only negative in our experience was in the gym - the treadmills are poor quality (no cushioning and sticks when you run) so we could not use them. The rest of the gym, however, had good quality machines and weights so we could still have a good workout. If you are visiting Vancouver and you want to treat yourself, this hotel is a must – you will LOVE it! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “The Absolute Apex of Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: TurtleCreekTraveller
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have eloquently stated, the Rosewood Hotel Georgia is indeed special and its list of outstanding qualities quite long. The restoration of a heritage building has been gorgeously executed, both in public areas and the rooms themselves. At every turn one finds a fixture, texture, or material of interest or an appreciated touch of luxury. From Hawksworth restaurant to the salt-water pool, every touch is artfully presented, and the room, bed, and bath are truly top-drawer. As much as I love the property, service is the element that places the Hotel Georgia in a league of its own. Everyone is warm, caring, sophisticated, truly kind, and so very good at what they do, as evidenced by: *A U.S. customs and immigration form sent to my room the evening before departure by Connie from concierge services. First time any hotel has ever had that level of forethought and attention to detail and I travel internationally many times a year. *On the morning of checkout, my excellent housekeeper who kept the room spotless, calls me by name and shared that she hoped I had enjoyed my stay. *Jim will put you in the Bentley saloon and truly transport you to a different place. He is gifted and passionate and the moments whiling away with him are truly special. Obviously I'm smitten along with the majority and the property is virtually perfect. I'd only make a few small observations: *As others have stated, one does hear a bit of outside noise if facing the street, so it would be nice if the high setting on the room's fan system were a bit more effective in generating white noise. *A sauna and steam room would be a great addition to the tremendous amenities. *Some properties offer excellent views of the harbor and Stanley Park and Hotel Georgia isn't situated well for that. I'm anxiously awaiting next year's Conde Nast Gold List, expecting Hotel Georgia to quickly take a vaunted spot, and if you have been looking for service that will leave you smiling, I suspect you've found it!

Reviews.Title: “A great addition to the Rosewood brand.”
Reviews.Author: Paul A
Reviews.Content: I had previously stayed at the Rosewood Sand Hill in CA twice before on business and so my expectations for this visit were set high... and were greatly exceeded. I knew that this was a reno'd historical hotel, so was not 100% sure what to expect going in but chose this hotel for a 3-day family stay leading up to business meetings at the hotel the following week. The room we were in (a Deluxe room with two beds - we had a complimentary and very nice roll-away bed for our other child) was fantastic. My family and I were treated like royalty, from the teddy bears for the kids upon check-in, being addressed by name, the kids' bathrobes in the rooms, the complimentary Bentley rides to locations nearby, the very (but appropriately so) attentive and eager-to-please concierge, check-in, parking, door and bell staff. The driving instruction cards for nearby attractions were a valuable item provided by the concierge desk. I cannot say enough about the service provided by the entire staff and the way they made us feel so welcome and valued. Will definitely stay there again. Two small bits of feedback we provided the hotel were that (our room category, at least): 1) was short on drawer space to store our clothing, so we literally lived out of our suitcases for an extended stay, and 2) our room did not have a bathtub for our three year-old, so she got to experience a shower for the first time. Honestly, though, these two minor inconveniences were completely overshadowed by everything else we experienced during our stay. By the way, all the attendees of the business meetings which followed after my family left were equally impressed by this hotel and its staff. You can't beat the location of this hotel either.

Reviews.Title: “A modern Treasure”
Reviews.Author: Jinna_11
Reviews.Content: The new facelift was worth the wait. The interior brought back class and elegance to Vancouver. The Staff and congeriege were helpful and attentive. The rooms were very tasteful and welcoming, the beds I would compare to sleeping on a cloud. The 1972 lounge of the hotel is very quaint and cozy, the wait staff gave excellent service.Hawksworth restuarant is a vibrant and up beat lounge, great selection of drinks and snacks. Another great attribute to the hotel is the location is in the heart of Vancouver with everything within a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the Best - and I've seen them all”
Reviews.Author: theLuckiestGuy
Reviews.Content: Absolutely incredible. This is the hotel Vancouver was missing. More like Toronto's Hazelton than the Loden. Attention to detail and decorating excellence like the Peninsula in Beverly Hills back when it was brand new. This is the new benchmark.. Toss the Fairmont Pac Rim (I've stayed in the Pacific Rim's Chaiman's suite for a week and liked this place head and shoulders better). Unfortunately the Loden and Opus are out - Poor Locations. Toss the Sutton.. (wayy in need of updates) Toss the Bayshore.. old and routine with just a few great rooms.. Toss the Four Seasons.. It's right across the street and this place pput's it to jawdropping shame. There is not another hotel in the city of Vancouver, not one that you want to hang your hat at after you've stayed here. I would come back to Vancouver JUST for this hotel. THAT's how you know when you've found the best - It just completely and unequivocally blows your hair back. I've stayed in more hotels in my life than I care to remember and I predict that this place will have waiting lists within a year. Note to management: Take the yoga room that nobody is using and put some freeweights and a bench in there.. The gym had no free weights.. That's the only fault.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Beth C
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our 4 night stay at the Hotel Georgia. The building and finishes are beautiful. Every staff member we encountered from concierge to housekeeper had a genuine interest in making our stay an enjoyable one. We felt absolutely pampered. The bed was extraordinarily comfortable with luxurious linens. The bathroom felt like a spa with heated marble floors, fluffy towels and cozy robes. The espresso machine was sweet as were the shortbread cookies with the turn down service. We also took advantage of the stunning saltwater pool and the complimentary car service (nice Bentley!) We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel, based on the outstanding service alone.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: gubbs79
Reviews.Content: Really can't describe how much we loved this hotel (but I'll try!) We've been back home for nearly a week now and we still can't stop talking about it. There were so many luxurious details, which - combined with the outstanding customer service - all added up to a feeling of having been totally pampered. It's one of the few hotels where I can honestly say the room looked as beautiful as the glossy official website photos. All the staff were excellent and the downtown location was central, yet we didn't notice any excessive street noise (we were on floor 7). The attention to detail that has obviously gone into recreating the ambience of the original hotel really works. The bed was so comfortable, the turn-down service included several thoughtful little touches, the heated floor in the bathroom was great and the rainforest shower was amazing. We decided to have breakfast in the Hawksworth restaurant one morning and it was delicious, again with impeccable service. All in all I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to treat themselves to a luxurious hotel experience at a non-outlandish price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, luxurious, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: RazzTazz23
Reviews.Content: Wow. This hotel is brand new and its location is great. We walked everywhere from the hotel on our mini vacation or took advantage of the house Bentley when we could. The hotels itself is gorgeous. Beautiful dark wood and marble everywhere. This was renovated to the highest standard. The pool is gorgeous and the gym is large with lots of machines. There is a business center with a printer and computer if you need it. The hotel’s bar is very nice with great service, good drinks and excellent food. The staff is great. Housekeeping kept out room clean and was very prompt with requests. They did little nice touches such as leaving out some glasses cleaner when they saw our glasses sitting on the counter in the bathroom. The concierge was superb and the house car driver, Jim, was a delight. Check in was painless. The rooms are great. Big comfy beds with top quality linens. Huge marble bathrooms with gorgeous rain showers. A big flat screen Sony tv. A nice espresso machine. Pretty much every amenity you could think of was in the room. I highly recommend this hotel. One of the best I have stayed in. A surprisingly good value too - we had a very reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “VANCOUVER'S BEST HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Karenlovestotravel55
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying for 3 nights at this stunning hotel. The furnishings are beautiful, the bathroom is gorgeous; however, what makes this hotel stand above and beyond the rest is the people who work here. Everyone seems to really, really enjoy their jobs. They made us feel like we were genuinely welcome at their hotel. They couldn't do enough for us. Everyone at the concierge desk was more than helpful and the driver of The Bentley was very professional and friendly. We will definitely be back and would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for some pampering. Did I mention the bed? - the most comfortable we have ever slept in!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional in every way !”
Reviews.Author: tripgal1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in both a Junior and 1 bedroom suite. The rooms were spacious and loaded with amenities! Enormous tub, heated bath floors and the largest shower ever. The Jr suite was an interior courtyard room and proved to be quieter than the corner suite. The one bedroom suite was situated on the corner of the intersection, offering plenty of light with large windows on both exterior walls. The separate bedroom with desk and sitting area, extra bath, pantry, dining area and living room all proved the 1 bedroom to be functional, comfortable and welcoming. Mesmerizing views of the city lights and historic architecture across the way. Service - warm and welcoming throughout! Always friendly, efficient and informative. Hotel car was uber-convenient and the driver = what a gem! The fine details everywhere on the property made this trip spectacular. Wish we were in Vancouver more often.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Christina L
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure to stay at Rosewood Hotel Georgia. What an amazing Hotel. The staff was so service minded, I stayed in a Deluxe Room and had the best bath ever! I was attending a meeting. Banquet staff was very attentive and the food was great. I loved the natural light in the meeting space. Thank you Rosewood Hotel Georiga for a great stay and for making our meeting a sucess.

Reviews.Title: “Little piece of heaven right in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: LadyLuxe14
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed at Georgia after an amazing wedding we've photographed in Yaletown. I've been to Georgia a few times before but not since the renovations and I was delighted to see that the old world charm is still there but amplified with lavish modern updates. The staff was absolutely incredible from the moment we walked in- bride and groom in tow- to the moment we checked out the next day. On Monday, I received an email from one of the reps making sure that our stay was nothing short of perfection. It really was. We were exhausted after a long day of shooting but we stayed up extra late to look around the hotel and our suite and enjoy the amenities...and late night snacks. Highly recommend the room service menu- it was so tasty! Cannot say enough about this place- we've stayed at many wonderful hotels but Georgia raises the bar. From the little things such as the privacy button right next to your bedside (no more annoying door knob hangers!) to the most comfortable beds, to gorgeous decor...I could live there. I have never experience such a smooth and pleasant check-in/check-out. The best part? Georgia is in Vancouver! All the luxury, beauty and sophistication without airfare. It is a "must stay" whether you live here or just visiting. I simply cannot wait- in fact working on an excuse ;) - to visit it again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted!”
Reviews.Author: Over_the_River
Reviews.Content: The title describes how I felt at every turn during our stay at the Rosewood Georgia. From our warm and personal greeting when we arrived quite late in the evening to our super smooth checkout (shall we leave it on your card? would you like the receipt in email? can I call you a cab?) we found much to be delighted about. A surprise bottle of bubbly and chocolate covered strawberries courtesy of the manager to celebrate our anniversary. Excellent food and service in Hawksworth. Cookies and fresh ice each evening when we returned to our room. Luxurious bed and enormous bath with high quality amenities. Staff at every engagement determined to exceed whatever expecations we had about hotel service - and wildly succeeding. Beautifully decorated room, free bottled water, free wifi, internet access through the TV - where's a keyboard? exactly in the first place we looked for it. We did either have issues with getting in room movies on our TV, or there were none, which was odd, but we quickly moved on to other opportunities. Some noise from the road below, but much better than many city center hotels. The package with breakfast (restaurant or room service) and parking was a great deal. They helped make our anniversary wonderful and we will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: maygen28
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting the Hotel Georgia since I was a little girl and had my 19th birthday there long befor it was closed for renovations. I have been looking forward to the re-opening for a long time and was very excited to see that I could stay here this time I was passing through Vancouver. Seeing as you get you're 3rd night free right now it makes staying that much more awesome. Check in, is a breeze. The bellman was very friendly and helpful making sure to explain how all the lighting and tv works. About 10 minutes after checkin they will call to make sure you are satisfied with everything in your room. I was on the 7th floor facing the art gallery. For some people you may find it a bit noisy, however city noise doesnt bother me. The view was lovely. The room itself is lovely. The bathroom is FANTASTIC!! And in all honesty the bed is THE MOST comfortable bed I have ever had the pleasure to sleep on. Truly fantastic! The pool is beautiful and although I didnt use the fitness room it looked great as well. I had breakfast twice and dinner once from roomservice. Again it was fantastic. Great service and great food. Hawksworth's is definatly worth a visit. I went for dinner. My server was efficient, knowlegable, not pretentious, and didnt hover and wasnt overly flamboyant which is what I prefer. To say the food was fantastic is an understatment. The drinks were amazing! Wow! Try a mint julep! Also the lobby bar is a nice place to have a quick bite and a refreshing drink if you have been out enjoying the city. Last time I was in Vancouver I stayed at Shangrila. In my opinion the Hotel Georgia is the BEST place to stay in Vancouver. I will not stay anywhere else in future visits to the city. If you are thinking of booking for a special occasion. Dont hesitate! You wont be dissapointed :)

Reviews.Title: “We will be back! AMAZING!!! hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: lior m
Reviews.Content: Walking into this hotel was just magical. A lovely gentleman named Brian greeted us at the door, and we have never felt so welcome in a hotel establishment. They have managed to create an oasis of quiet, beauty, cleanliness, aesthetic sophistication, and luxury. The rooms are beautifully appointed and the entire hotel smells fresh and sweet. The maids came by twice daily, and our lady even thoughtfully placed our books on the bed when she turned it down, leaving the lights dimmed and shortbread cookies and water by the bedside with our slippers. We felt like royalty returning to our palace at the end of each evening. The staff of this hotel is just AMAZING, and the staff at the Concierge (Heather, Connie and Rob to name a few) desk made our trip ever more delightful with helpful recommendations... Jim is such a lovely sweet guy - you will find out who he is when you stay at the Rosewood Hotel Georgia. We came for the second part of our honeymoon, and we hope to return OFTEN!!! I can't recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Dreamy hotel, attention to detail and staff top notch!”
Reviews.Author: ASC92
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to stay at the Rosewood Hotel Georgia within the first 2 weeks of its opening. I travel a fair amount and have a very critical mind, but this hotel stay was nearly perfect in all ways. The extensive restoration retains the classic nature of the hotel, but incorporates almost any modern convenience one would want from a luxury hotel. From very first moment, making our reservation, the care and pride of the staff was clear. Dianne took personal care with our reservation, even though we were booking with the opening special rate. We arrived almost 2 hours before I had predicted and several hours before the official check in time. Grace checked us in and went to check the room to ensure it was ready for us (it had been cleaned but not signed off on yet). She came back down and informed us that it smelled like smoke (who smokes in a brand-new non-smoking hotel??). Even though we were early, they did not make us wait for another similar room to be available; they immediately upgraded us to a junior suite. Simply amazing service. Next great surprise, a knock at the door and the manager sent a bottle of sparkling wine and delicious chocolates, wishing us a happy anniversary (our 9th) (Dianne had asked when booking). The suite was unbelievable. Brand new so everything was perfect. But was also so tastefully decorated, conveniently laid out, and luxurious. We especially enjoyed the Nespresso machine (here's my one complaint, they offered only non-dairy creamer in the room, though the concierge kindly sent up half&half when I brought this up), the heated bathroom floor, the super comfortable bed, and the tv screens that acted as computer screens. Turn down and housekeeping fantastic. Bookmarks placed in books, cleaning wipes placed next to glasses cases, every thoughtful gesture made. The pool, spa and restaurant were great and as with the rest of the hotel, the staff were so genuinely excited about the hotel and eager to help, they made it all the better. We were poking around the conference rooms one night, and the conference manager saw us and gave us a full tour; again, his enthusiasm for the hotel was palpable. And don't miss a Manhattan in the hotel bar. A final quick mention of the wonderful concierge team. Everyone was ready and more than able to give great suggestions. Robert particularly took us under his wing with great charm, insight and just plain joy. Bottom line, only problem with this hotel is that you will never want to leave, which is a pity in such a great city. If you do, you're close to everything so wander from time to time!

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel!”
Reviews.Author: zitzapper
Reviews.Content: The rooms were commodious. The staff was accommodating beyond belief. The Bentley sedan and driver (Jim) were a pleasant surprise and very much appreciated. I definitely would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Retro Hotel with modern touches”
Reviews.Author: traveller3232
Reviews.Content: This hotel just re-opened in July after a top to bottom reno. It is a gorgeous building in a great central downtown location. Everything has been done to give that vintage look with modern conveniences. Walking distance to the water and shopping. Room was amazing with quality everywhere. Service was top-notch. Cool 4th floor lounge for patio drinks. Pool is small and was on the cool side for temperature. I would put this place up there with other 5 star Vancouver hotels such as Shangra-La. You will not be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: MSV3534
Reviews.Content: This is probably the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in. The hotel and rooms were just gorgeous. The hotel staff was wonderful and extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We could not find any flaw”
Reviews.Author: AradTraveler
Reviews.Content: It is rare to visit a city and want to return for the hotel. The service at the Georgia was warm and exceptional in all areas, the room wonderful and every need was anticipated. Somehow our names were remembered even if we were only there for one night. They prepared a wonderful minicake at breakfast for my husband's birthday. A truly superior staff; the hotel excels in all areas. Also a new excellent restaurant just opened in the hotel, very much worth trying for both food and design and ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service at the Rosewood”
Reviews.Author: mfuson77
Reviews.Content: I selected the Rosewood over all other hotels in Vancouver mostly because I do like that old world charm they have maintained coupled with recent modern technologies. I found the valet, bell and front desk staff extremely attentive from the moment I arrived. The staff was very apologetic that I was frustrated at how hard it was to get into the valet parking area. I had to circle the block 3 times (Friday afternoon rush hour) which took almost half an hour. I can't blame the hotel for the traffic but the construction next to the hotel does obstruct the valet driveway which made entry to the hotel confusing. Once I was inside the staff took care of everything! The front desk was fast and efficient, the bell service was at my room within two minutes of my entry into the room and they even had a hotel staff showed me to my room and introduced me to the features. The room itself was elegant and tastefully decorated. Truth be told I had hoped to get a room on a higher floor (quieter) and a room with a separate sitting area. I didn't complain at the time so I shouldn't complain now, having said that I did like my room. I really enjoyed the rain shower and toiletries and the bed was very comfortable. Channel selection on the TV seemed limited and I had no pay per-view movies - only porn movies which seemed odd. The complimentary internet also worked great! My only complaint with my room was the noise from outside - which I knew I higher floor would have helped with. Another feature I liked were the historical cards turn down left in the room. These cards had information about celebrities that had stayed in the hotel, when they were born and died. One was about Elvis which I had to point out to the staff had the wrong date of death - they had 1970 written in the card. I know the last 7 years of his life weren't remarkable but I don't think we should forget about them entirely! I also did a spa treatment at Sense which was fantastic. The staff was incredible and beckoned to any need that I may have had. The pool was also nice; it's rare to have a lap pool in a hotel which I do enjoy. The entry to the pool was awkward, through the spa - and I think they could use some more signage in this area to help guests. I also used the gym. I'm a gym rat by nature and hotels never come close to offering weights that I can lift. The Rosewood gym was well equipped with Cardio equipment and they offered a series of machines for weight training - no free weights though. They need some rubber grip mats under the weight machines - the machines slide around on the wood floor when you are lifting heavy weights. In all it was an excellent hotel gym. I ate at Hawksworth for breakfast one day. The food was awesome! I also ate in the 1927 lounge which I would have loved to have sat in for longer. The 1927 lounge had great ambiance and a terrific barkeep! I also took advantage of the complimentary Bentley for a ride to the symphony which made the evening that much more! All in all I would highly recommend the Rosewood. Every hotel has issues, and the few issues the Rosewood may have are minor. The largest asset this property has is the staff, which is second to none! Everyone always stopped to talk to me regardless of what they were doing. If I was waiting for the elevator the housekeeper would stop and chat. It was a very welcoming property!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Warren M
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic hotel. It had everything. We stayed 3 nights in a Premier Executive Room and got a great deal - book 3 nights and pay for only two. Hotel has undergone 4 years of renovation according to one of the staff where they halved the number of rooms and it really shows. Huge room with a lounge area. Huge bathroom - double vanity either side of the bathroom, huge designer bath and a shower you could fit half-a-dozen people in with ceiling rain shower. Fantastic flatscreen TV which also came with free Internet connection. Our iPad and laptop where also easily connected into the hotel's free wireless. Staff were fantastic and really know what service is - obviously a focus of the hotel and it shows. Everyone chats to you and are really helpful. Concierge desk was great with several great restaurant recommendations. This will be my Vancouver hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Living in the lap of luxury!”
Reviews.Author: KBLB76
Reviews.Content: An beautiful Victorian style boutique hotel recently remodeled has made my list of best places I have ever stayed. Our recent night at the Rosewood Hotel Georgia has convinced me I will never stay anywhere else in Vancouver. Amazing! There were so many things I loved about it, I could go on forever. But just to name a few...first off the employees at the hotel from the valets, to the front desk to the concierge and management are first class. I don't believe I have ever been treated more kindly and felt more valued as a guest as I did at this hotel. Next, the room...wow! What can I say, other than amazing! The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in at a hotel (Italian linens, big fluffy duvet, feather bed, etc). The room was spacious and the amenities amazing from the free standing tub, to the rainfall shower, dual vanities and two high tech switches for the all lighting, making it so easy to turn on all the lights, which lit up the room wonderfully. Not the usual strain to see across the room lighting which most hotels have. Finally, the little details of service like the turndown service where velvety soft towels and pillowy soft slippers are placed at the side of the bed, or the surprise birthday cake from management in our room and the wonderful espresso maker instead of the usual stale, bland coffee and cheap coffee makers usually found in hotel rooms...all of this made my one night at the Hotel Georgia the best night I have had in my many hotel stays, and just to give you a frame of reference, I do consider myself, a "hotel snob." I am very picky about where I stay. Needless, to say, I cannot wait to return! And to top it off Sunday Brunch at Hawksworth restaurant was wonderful! Thanks to all at this hotel for making our stay so memorable!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff that consistently exceeded expectations.”
Reviews.Author: fcsoft
Reviews.Content: The room had a great view of the Vancouver Art Gallery and was very comfortable. Every person at the hotel was upbeat and went out of their to make us happy. Our first night we requested a taxi. The next thing we know the staff arranges the hotel's Bentley to drop us off for dinner. What service

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: Jimmyunderwood
Reviews.Content: My father and I have just returned from a fishing trip to Canada, during which we stayed at the Rosewood Hotel Georgia for 3 nights from 17th - 20th Sept and I have to say having stayed at many luxury hotels worldwide this is undoubtedly one of the best, the rooms are a decent size and the beds very comfortable. But what makes the difference at this hotel is the staff, we found every one of them extremely courteous and helpful and you get the feeling that they genuinely enjoy working there. A special mention goes to Michael the concierge who ensured we ate at the best restaurants and maximised our stay as much as possible. All in all I would say well done to the management at the hotel who have formed an excellent team coupled with a real luxury feel. Keep up the good work. James & Bob Nottingham, UK.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lazigirl
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Newly opened. Huge room with sitting area, best bathroom in a hotel I have stayed in. Great room service. Didn't eat in restaurant however. Staff very friendly, helpful. Few teething problems but nothing that interfered with our stay. Room quiet, bed so comfortable. Loved the small touches- the slippers, cookies at turn down, the products in the bathroom.Hard to be critical of anything! Will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel...housekeeping might be improved”
Reviews.Author: cricrides
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights in this brand new hotel. Extremely warm welcome and the staff is very friendly. The spa is excellent, nice fitness room and for once, a swimming pool of a decent size. Rooms are big and the bathroom is extremly well fitted! I loved the shower! One negative point is the house keeping: - don't run your fingers on the plint, they are full of dust. - clock on the bed side tables was dusty when I arrived and remained dusty until I left... - Bathroom floor has not been cleaning during the entire stay... I would expect from a hotel in this category, to have a perfecly clean room and at least have a bathroom cleaned to perfection...every day.

Reviews.Title: “Not equal to the build-up, or price”
Reviews.Author: Mary1930
Reviews.Content: We were greeted promptly and efficiently by the valet and bellman but the front desk person was by himself with a line-up of people waiting to be helped. Lots of noise from outside streets. Eyeglass wipes at turn-down were a nice, different touch. I was disappointed to find the room small and with several items not working, such as the TV or the headboard lights. The headboard lights, we were told by the staff, did not work in any room. The TV was also not repaired before we left. We don't know what was the matter as no one followed-up with us after maintenance attended.

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend trip to Vancouver, BC Canada”
Reviews.Author: Robert M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rosewood Hotel Georgia in Vancouver for three nights in September,2011. The Hotel was originally built in 1927. The Rosewood group completed a four year construction project in July, 2011. It is a great hotel with quality staff from check-in, concierge, bell captain, valet parking and a Bentley car, with driver, for less than 5 Kms from hotel. Our room was good sized with a sitting area, large flat screen TV, ample closet space with a great bathroom with two sinks, great overhead shower as well as a bath tub. The electrical lighting system was great throughout the hotel room. The Hotel has a great restaurant called the Hawksworth, on site as well as two bars/cocktail areas in the hotel. We would without doubt stay at the Rosewood on our next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: spuzzum72
Reviews.Content: I will not repeat what has already been said here except to note that I visit a lot of hotels and very few impress me as much as this one did. The rooms, service staff, overall experience are first class. No details are missed here, yet it remains unpretentious. I was impressed when I came in from errands very under dressed, just looking like another tourist and asked for directions to the washroom on the main floor. They did not know I was a hotel guest but nevertheless the front desk staff smiled and pointed me to the washrooms, then called over a concierge walked me there. Little things like this MATTER! Kudos to the HR people at Rosewood, they obviously know how to find the right people for the industry. The only things I could complain about are completely outside of the control of the hotel, such as sirens and other street noise ( which where very acceptable with the windows closed). The noise levels insdide the hotel were outstanding, I heard nothing from other rooms. when I return to Vancouver there is no question where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Raeleanne
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in September 2011 on a business trip to Vancouver. I was amazed with my good fortune to stay at the Rosewood Georgia Hotel. Upon arrival the staff were attentive and informative. Check in was smooth with no issues. The front desk attendant showed me to my room, explained the features and made me feel wholly welcome. The room was fantastic and comfortable. Room 706 overlooked the Vancouver Art Gallery. There was no noise from the street. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom had a great bathtub, rain shower, and many extra amenities. I ordered room service both mornings. Both times I ordered blueberry pancakes and coffee. The first morning was outstanding. The second morning was good, but somewhat disappointing after the exceptional breakfast from the morning before.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; Superb service”
Reviews.Author: Cecily F
Reviews.Content: We just visited Vancouver for the first time, and stayed 4 nights at the Rosewood Hotel Georgia. We got a great price online and then were ofered an upgrade when our flight was cancelled due to the flooding in the NE. The hotel is a lovely old building completely updated and upgraded to include every kind of amenity. The location is perfect--right across from the art museum and in the center of Vancouver. We walked almost everywhere. In addition to the location, the Hotel Georgia offered the most amazing service we have every experienced. At every turn, the staff was friendly and helpful; I almost think they read minds, they were so quick to offer help. They provide water when you pick up your car as wll as printed directions; glasses cleaner was on the bed side table when I left my glasses case out; bottled water on the bedside table along with delicious cookies--all in all, we really felt pampered. The restaurant--Hawksworth--is amazing. It's not inexpensive, but worth the cost. All in all, it was a great trip and a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: missLKPA
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay here! They did a stellar job with excellent attention to detail and they really made me feel special!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: CAB71
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from a short trip to Vancouver visiting with her parents and since it was our anniversary we opted to spend one night (Sept 2) in the City. I had read that the Hotel Georgia had been recently renovated and I was lucky to find a really excellent price online (probably 1/2 of what the room should've cost), so we figured what the heck and splurged on a 5 star luxury hotel. Location The location is pretty prime - right downtown, across from the Art Museum and the Pacific Centre, and also very close to the central business district, for business travellers. There's a Canada Line stop a block away and its a short walk to Gastown, and the seabus terminal. The Hotel All I can say is "wow". The hotel has been renovated, from top to bottom - I understand they even cut the number of rooms from 300 to 155. The Hotel Georgia has long been the tradition luxury hotel in Vancouver (along with the Hotel Vancouver, which is nearby), so it has that very "classic" look to it. Credit to Rosewood keeping the same look and feel of the old hotel while modernizing it with all of the amenities you would expect nowadays in 5 star accommodations. The hotel has a new courtyard bar, called Reflections, which is becoming an "it" spot in Vancouver. It's completely outdoors, though partially covered (makes sense in Vancouver, given the rain) and a nice infinity pool. A number of the rooms face the courtyard, which can make it tricky if you want to go to bed early, but to the hotel's credit, they do last call at 11 at the bar and shut it down by 12. We weren't able to get a table at the restaurant, Hawksworth, but I hear its quite good. The hotel also has a full service spa, but due to our short stay, we didn't get a chance to try it out. The Room We stayed in a Luxury King Room (which is one up from their standard room), thanks to the upgrade. The room was beautiful and large especially the bathroom, (which was almost as big as the rest of the room), which had a full-sized soaker tub, his and hers vanities on opposite sides, and a shower with a "rainforest-style" shower head. Of course, the room has the standard "luxury hotel" features, such as 42" HD Flat screen TV, super comfortable bed, room safe, etc. The room is on par with hotels of this class, though the bathroom is one of the best I've seen. Unlike some of the newer hotels, none of the rooms have views of the water or mountains, but you can see the mountains from anywhere in downtown Vancouver, and the city surrounded on all sides by water, so its not that big a deal. The Service Every second of our experience with the hotel was fantastic. Even making the reservation - the reservation agent, Bethany was incredibly helpful and even called me after I made the reservation to let me know she had upgraded our room at no extra charge. Then when we arrived, the staff was excellent, from the valet parking (very stylish hats fellas) to check-in, to the bellhop who showed us around the newly renovated room, to the concierge who fixed our dinner reservations, to Jim "Mr. Bentley" who drove us to and from dinner in the hotel's brand new Bentley (a great service the hotel offers if you ask) - what a way to travel! I almost forgot to mention that the hotel had chocolate dipped strawberries and a bottle of champagne on ice, with a lovely welcome note from management waiting for us in the room when we arrived. All in all, the service is top-notch. Bottom line: I would stay there again in a heartbeat and have no hesitation is recommending it for someone visiting Vancouver. Nice job Rosewood!

Reviews.Title: “Great place,....central,..and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JC-Delage
Reviews.Content: Had a 3 nights stay. Very good accommodations, and a very good bar and restaurant too.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: dandrew
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Vancouver and I must say I was thoroughly impressed with the Rosewood Hotel Georgia. It was also my first time staying at a Rosewood hotel and again I was thoroughly impressed. The hotel is in the center of the city across the street from the art museum and near the shopping district. It is on the fifth ave of Vancouver. When you enter the hotel you are greet by one of the numerous staff of the hotel. Check in was easy despite a hick up in the reservation which was easily fixed. The staff of the hotel was helpful but not overly intrusive. If you ever needed anything there was a employee to help you. Although that may have been because the hotel seem somewhat empty. Our room was not the largest but perfectly adequate for our needs and had numerous luxury features. From the small little touches like the control panel by the side of the bed to the heated floor in the bathroom. Oh not to mention the bathroom had an amazing shower! The hotel is not stingy with their services from free wifi to complementary use of the hotel bentley. Overall I would definitely recommend the hotel georgia. It was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at and I have stayed at some of the best hotels in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: judyongena
Reviews.Content: There is no comparison for staff and accomodations! Rosewood has by far the most courteous friendly staff of any hotel we've ever visited! What I truly loved is that they treat every guest as if they are a celebrity! Our room was luxurious! The hotel restaurant is superb!! I would truly recommend this hotel to business and vacation travelers alike. The location is 2 blocks from the harbor and centrally located downtown. If he's available -Jim will drive you to your destination in the Rosewood Bentley! Loved, loved, loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Newly Opened”
Reviews.Author: CAKarenOrangeCounty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It opened summer of 2011 - so everything is new. Nice workout facility with top notch equipment - super indoor lap pool. The only problem is I am a frequent Four Seasons traveler and I am accustomed to having an executive suite that could accommodate 3-4 people, as the sofa is also a bed. We ended up with two connecting rooms - but everyone was very comfortable. Beds were super comfortable..my bathroom had a heated floor - really luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “A place to stay when you are in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: SFTraveler33
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Shangri-la Vancouver first since it was one of the newest hotels in town. A couple weeks before our departure, we noticed the Rosewood Hotel Georgia opened. At first we reluctantly reserved our room there since it was so new. As most new hotels, the service could be a hit or miss and the amenities might not be readily available. However, we could resist the decor of the room, the central location, and beautiful indoor pool so we decided to give it a try. The services were simply wonderful. It was attentive yet not too intrusive. The staff were welcoming and friendly but not stuffy or stuck up as some of those from older luxury hotels. Everyone was helpful and polite from the valet parking attendant to the room service staff. The room was exactly as it is shown in the hotel's website photos. The pool was beautiful and spotless. We had room service and the food was very good. It was a bit on pricey side as it is a Rosewood hotel, but it is worth it if you are too lazy or tired to get dressed and go out. We also tried Hawksworth restaurant in the hotel. We were pleasantly surprised at how great the food was and the service was top notch. As for the negatives, there aren't a lot to discuss here. Just to be picky, they didn't have drink service at the pool area yet. We commented that on our survey and the general manager told us they are still waiting for alcohol license so that service should be available soon. The TV didn't work on the first night we were there. We didn't really care since we were not going to watch TV in Vancouver anyway, but it was fixed the next day as soon as we mentioned to the staff. This last issue is not the hotel but rather the restaurant. They didn't really have a proper dress code so you will see all kinds of people there. From couples in their suits and gown celebrating their special events to those "lesser class" who came in with shorts, t-shirts, flip-flops and expected immediate attention from the wait staff. If you ignore those around you, you would have an enjoyable meals as we did. Overall, we would definitely return and stay at the hotel when we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever Great Concierge”
Reviews.Author: travel v
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I have ever stayed at great for everyone luxurious comfortable beds would stay again!! The pool was beautiful!!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Luxury - Definitely a Potential 5-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: myluvoftravel
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Rosewood Hotel Georgia 2.5 weeks after a grand opening from a massive gutting and renovation of this landmark Vancouver property, and a rebranding to the Rosewood name, I found this property to be pure classic luxury with the highest standards to offer their guests. The entire staff are outstanding, most welcoming, hospitable, and takes great interest in your stay at their property. The entire staff are very proud to be at the Rosewood Hotel Georgia and their enthusiasm definitely shines through. The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful while very relaxing. I did not get that stuffy feeling you can get staying at a top luxury hotel. The hotel exudes a welcoming, sit down and relax feeling. The furnishings in the lobby are gorgeous and fits the decor perfectly. The room I had was on the 6th floor overlooking Howe Street. The room windows do open wide - how refreshing it was to find this. I could hear no noise at all, street level or outside the room. The room itself is luxury. The furnishings, color coordination, bed and bedding (the best ever) (sorry Frette) and lighting are perfection. I might also add very, very, comfortable, beautiful, and of the best craftsmanship. Touch lighting is utilized throughout the room. A computer keyboard in the desk drawer is available for use anytime and set up through the television system - and free of charge. A very nice touch and was used. I also liked the Seiko alarm clock that was stylish yet very simple to set an alarm. We know how hotels have gotten with trying to set an alarm on a clock. The bathroom - possibly the best I have encountered, Huge is not the word. You could live in the bathroom it is so big and beautiful. Everything is well thought out even down to the heated floor. You could have a party in the rainforest shower it is that big or possibly a smaller gathering in the soaking tub. All the amenities are there that one would expect at a luxury hotel and of the very highest quality. The fitness center/spa/pool are amazing. The fitness center has all the newest and latest equipment available in a wonderful and airy room to work out in. Again, all the nice touches one would look for at a hotel of the caliber are available. The pool area in my opinion is the second best feature of this hotel. Stunning, breathtaking, unbelievable are just a few words to describe this indoor pool area. Chairs, chaise lounges, couches, towels - again no expense spared in having the absolute best for this hotel. I actually felt like I was in some kind of Roman bath. You must stay if for anything the pool area. I did have breakfast at Hawksworth Restaurant. Decor, service, and food were excellent and price point was what is expected of a dining establishment of this high caliber. Absolutely no complaints for breakfast at Hawksworth. I utilized the business center and was very surprised to see two brand new Mac computers, the top of the line Mac computers for complimentary use. Being Mac illiterate, the hotel staff was most helpful in getting me started. The 1927 lobby bar was very nice, the drink was excellent, service outstanding, and pleasant, and overall a very relaxing time spent. Definitely have a drink or two there. The staff of the Rosewood Hotel Georgia is the #1 best feature of this property. Of the staff, the concierge staff I had multiple dealings with, Heather and Rob are the shining stars of the Hotel Georgia. Both are Members, Les Clefs d'Or Canada as well as the other team member of the concierge staff and one will be attaining membership into this prestigious organization in November, making the Rosewood Hotel Georgia the only hotel in Canada to have four Members Les Clefs d'Or Canada. This staff, again, particularly Heather and Rob know the city of Vancouver nside and out, all recommendations were right on, and some unusual requests were handled professionally, timely, and always with the result I the guest was looking for. My many interactions with this team certainly made me feel like I was their only guest. Heather and Rob are very special people and take pride in their work and pride in their hotel. I cannot highly recommend enough using their knowledge and services offered. As I said at the beginning of this review, all staff members are enthusiastic, proud of their job, and proud to be of any service to their guests to make the stay a very memorable on. I was fortunate to be able to utilize the Bentley car and driver, Jim, to the Pacific Central Station. What can I say, I will never forget the ride, the car, nor Jim. Jim is a pleasure to talk to, always smiling, cheerful, and cares so much about the guest. He is such an asset to this organization and someone I shall not forget. Professional and caring at all times -- what more can you ask for in an employee or a person. I actually had wished he could have hopped on the train with me so we could continue our discussions on various topics. I apologize for this lengthy report, however, I really wanted to give future guests a clear picture of this property. Remember please, the Rosewood Hotel Georgia had only been open 2.5 weeks, so there were some issues and definite oversights I saw during my stay. I will say every staff member took their time to listen to my suggestions, ideas, and thoughts and I believe took them to heart. I did not hesitate to let them know too, in a nice way. To give you a good idea, the following was what I found. I was skipped one night for turn-down service. Was offered a very sincere apology from the Front Desk Manager regarding this oversight that should have never happened. My room was rather small. Not the huge rooms I have encountered at other luxury hotels. Very little space for clothing. This in my opinion was the weakest and most disappointing part of the hotel. Actually had to have housekeeping come and get the extra pillows and blanket just to give myself more space in the closet. The business center with its new computers,etc., had absolutely no supplies to utilize that is readily available unless it was all hiding. The spa/fitness center/pool area - as absolutely beautiful as it is, offered none of the touches you will find at a luxury property's spa/fitness center/pool, i.e., lockers, (there were only 2), places to sit and change, and all the toiletries that are offered that take it a step higher. No footwear to use while in this area nor were there robes to put on. Also, there was no place to put the wet swimsuit but this issue has been addressed and there will be a suit dryer installed as soon as the equipment gets in. I was very disappointed and surprised to see how lacking this area was in comparison to a Ritz Carlton, Four Seasons, Shangri-La, Pan-Pacific, and Fairmont properties fitness center/pool area. However, Lenny, Spa Receptionist was outstanding, proactive in tackling my dilemma, and solved my problem. She is definitely the kind of member you want on your team to take you to the top. Again, this was an outstanding stay, all the comforts one could want or ask for. The staff unsurpassed on their duties. The strongest asset of this hotel. However. to reach that pinnacle of being "the best Vancouver hotel" it is the small attention to details that separate properties as they are all in the general price range. This is where the Rosewood Hotel Georgia still needs improvement. It will be the little things that take it to the top and a 5-star rating. I will be back and cannot wait to see and notice the changes and the evolving nuances that take place to achieve this hospitality ranking as #1 place to stay in Vancouver. It can happen.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: vancouver23
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Georgia, a family of four and a dachshund. We've stayed at several hotels in Vancouver, but none of them is this special. The location is perfect. The restaurant, Hawkesworth, was extraordinary. Everyone who works there is kind and friendly and helpful. The bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept on. I've been searching online to find something comparable. The pool is gorgeous and so much fun with 8 geometric windows in the floor that continually change colour. If you go, be kind to them. They deserve it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel with Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: Vancana
Reviews.Content: Living here in Vancouver, we thought we'd take one for the team, and spend a couple of nights at this newly renovated landmark hotel so we could report our findings on this forum, to assist visitors in their decision in selecting accommodation. I know, a tough job, but someone's gotta do it! The restoration is superb, marrying the historic with the modern. A classy lobby greets you, complete with rich mahogany, brass and a dazzling chandelier. Touches of the past are to be found with the original staircase, and pieces like the old wall mounted mailbox, period clock above the entrance, and even retro elevator dials! We had a room on the 8th floor overlooking the art gallery, the best choice if you can swing it. The room was more like a small apartment, well appointed, and a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was huge, with two vanities, soaker tub, and separate walk in shower. A quality turn down service occurred each evening. A superb lap pool and modern fitness centre are on the 4th floor, a popular restaurant and the lobby lounge are located on the ground floor. We ate breakfast in the restaurant and had cocktails in the lounge, and both were excellent. Also a Bentley is made available to guests for complimentary use around the city centre. Look for the subtle nods to the past, doormen wearing fedora's, lounge waitresses wearing 1920's outfits and even "Sweet Georgia Brown" being played at 11-08 twice a day in recognition of the time it reopened! But it's the service that commands the greatest recognition. From the check in desk, to the concierges, to the bellmen and doormen, bar staff and Jim the driver, they executed their duties with the highest degree of professionalism. Extremely courteous, yet friendly. Well done! The only disappointment was the Prohibition Bar was still under construction, and it sounds like it will be a cool place once it's up and running, so there's a good reason to return! Overall, a stylish and thoughtful renovation of a classic 1927 hotel that scores a bulls eye. Expensive, but highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay at a Vancouver Landmark”
Reviews.Author: Marcella0
Reviews.Content: A most enjoyable stay at the Historic Georgia Hotel. This hotel has been totally refurbished to it's former glory!! My room was very well appointed, beautifully decorated and large. All conveniences are within the room. The bathroom was the highlight with its oval soaking tub!! Another important factor for me; all the windows opened. The staff were very courteous, efficient and seemed excited to be there. The hotel is centrally located and across the street from the Vancouver Art Gallery. I highly recommend this 'Boutique Style' hotel with all it's old world charm.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdrianTorontoOntario
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the most beautiful old world lobby, when they did the renovation, they preserved all of the old wood, fixtures, everything that was timeless. Then when you get to your room, you are in the modern age, and everything is beautifully designed and extremely comfortable. The beds and furniture are great, but the bathrooms are the best. I have stayed at the Four Seasons in Whistler, (which is gorgeous) and this hotel is equal in every measure. I actually liked the rooms in the Georgia better because I really liked the whole warm contemporary design they have. I only ate one meal there, but it was fantastic. They have "savoury" choices on the breakfast menu, so I tried one, it was their Rib Hash and it was really delicious. Not every kitchen could pull this off, but they did. I will return for sure

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous room and friendly attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: trudeau2010
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from our vacation to Vancouver and I just had to review the Hotel Georgia while the memory is still fresh in our minds. Wow! We really did good choosing the Hotel Georgia and will certainly consider staying there the next time we visit. There are so many fine Hotels in downtown Vancouver and we took a chance on Hotel Georgia because of it's proximately & price. I had a symposium to attend at another fine hotel but preferred not to stay in the same hotel for the sake of variety during our stay and Hotel Georgia was a good choice for us. The room was absolutely fabulous. The bathroom was OMG! The staff made us feel welcome upon our arrival and never let up making sure we had everything we needed or wanted. I highly recommend Hotel Georgia to the discerning traveler or anyone who appreciates great accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: vantellcare
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this place for your visit to Vancouver Beautiful British Columbia, we took the special offer to stay for 50% off for the grand opening package, amazing staffs with caring greeting from every floor, amazing restaurant, beautiful ambience, lovely room equip with everything that you cannot imagine, I try this hotel for my business Trinity East Investment to provide the type of quality to house foreign students and seniors in Vancouver. This is a place like home away from home.. lovely and elegant.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely faultless”
Reviews.Author: Sahara0meara
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I had the pleasure of spending 3 nights in sheer luxury in the Georgia. From the moment we arrived to our departure we were treated courteously by all the staff we encountered. Having stayed in several 5 star hotels in Europe, I can honestly say that the Georgia was by far the most luxurious we have had the fortune to stay in, with fantastic attention to detail. Our son is 10 months old and travelling with a baby can be a hassle, however upon arrival he was presented with a teddy. His crib came with a goody bag of baby necessities and a kettle and diaper genie were delivered to the room without request. The bed was ridiculously comfortable and the bathroom deserves a mention. We were very taken with the 'rainforest' shower. All in all, we had a faultless experience and the staff deserve a very special mention as they were so helpful and friendly. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: TxTree
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Georgia for one night while in Vancouver on business. I think it had been open for just a week and I was very impressed with the quality of the facilities and the staff. Lovely modern renovation of a glamorous old hotel, well located in the heart of Vancouver. My room (a deluxe) was perfect - nice little sitting area, comfortable desk for working, plush bedding, excellent lighting, great view of the art gallery. The highlight, though, was the bathroom, which was enormous and beautifully designed. The staff were all highly professional, gracious and welcoming. Room service was excellent and prompt. I also really enjoyed my breakfast at the Hawksworth restaurant - I had the dungeness crab eggs benedict, a delicious concoction I will be dreaming about for months to come. (Also, I didn't get to experience the pool or the spa, but they also looked beautiful.)

Reviews.Title: “1920's Elegance meets Modern Swagger!”
Reviews.Author: bellabear026
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed in this hotel for our wedding anniversary and the hotel is absolutely gorgeous! The hotel contains the elegance of the early 1920's with the beautiful wood paneled walls, crystal chandeliers and elevators that look like they were taking out of the prohibition era. It is exceptionally clean and the staff takes care of every minute detail. When my husband and I arrived, we quickly checked our car in to valet ($30) and then a gentleman dressed in a a beautiful suit and fedora, took our luggage to the front desk where the ladies took great care of us, even arranging for the in house car service (Bentley) to take us to our dinner reservations. The drive Jim is fabulous by the way! Upon entering our room, gold leafed chocolate covered strawberries were served on a silver platter with a silver bucket filled with ice and champagne was waiting for us (complimentary). The bedrooms brilliantly displayed a touch of modern technology (heated bathroom floors, rainfall shower,sensored lights) and with the beautiful elegance of a time that has passed (time period like furniture, brass, silver and gold). The staff is amazing!!! They took of absolutely everything we asked in a professional and speedy manner. I forgot my cell phone in my car and they speedily retrieved it. This is by far THE BEST hotel in vancouver, if you can afford to stay, definitely do so. Be prepared to have some cash in your pocket though as you will want to tip the staff at this hotel for their genuine, speedy and great attention to detail service. We will be back next year to celebrate our second anniversary for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world!”
Reviews.Author: joeycarona
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Vancouver and had the great joy of staying at the Rosewood Hotel Georgia during their opening week. The experience was perfection in every way. The hotel offers the perfect combination of new world features and and amenities encased within classic and timeless beauty. Words can't adequately descried how spot on everything in this hotel was. On a 1 to 10 scale, my experience was a 15.

HotelInfo.Name: Rosewood Hotel Georgia
HotelInfo.Address: 801 West Georgia Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V6C 1P7, Canada
